97#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
98namespace {
99
100class FullMarkingVerifier : public MarkingVerifierBase {
101 public:
102 explicit FullMarkingVerifier(Heap* heap)
103 : MarkingVerifierBase(heap),
104 marking_state_(heap->non_atomic_marking_state()) {}
105
106 void Run() override {
107 VerifyRoots();
108 VerifyMarking(heap_->new_space());
109 VerifyMarking(heap_->new_lo_space());
110 VerifyMarking(heap_->old_space());
111 VerifyMarking(heap_->code_space());
112 if (heap_->shared_space()) VerifyMarking(heap_->shared_space());
113 VerifyMarking(heap_->lo_space());
114 VerifyMarking(heap_->code_lo_space());
115 if (heap_->shared_lo_space()) VerifyMarking(heap_->shared_lo_space());
116 VerifyMarking(heap_->trusted_space());
117 VerifyMarking(heap_->trusted_lo_space());
118 }
119
120 protected:
121 const MarkingBitmap* bitmap(const MutablePageMetadata* chunk) override {
122 return chunk->marking_bitmap();
123 }
124
125 bool IsMarked(Tagged<HeapObject> object) override {
126 return marking_state_->IsMarked(object);
127 }
128
129 void VerifyMap(Tagged<Map> map) override { VerifyHeapObjectImpl(map); }
130
131 void VerifyPointers(ObjectSlot start, ObjectSlot end) override {
132 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
133 }
134
135 void VerifyPointers(MaybeObjectSlot start, MaybeObjectSlot end) override {
136 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
137 }
138
139 void VerifyCodePointer(InstructionStreamSlot slot) override {
140 Tagged<Object> maybe_code = slot.load(code_cage_base());
141 Tagged<HeapObject> code;
142 // The slot might contain smi during Code creation, so skip it.
143 if (maybe_code.GetHeapObject(&code)) {
144 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(code);
145 }
146 }
147
148 void VerifyRootPointers(FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
149 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
150 }
151
152 void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
153 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
154 Tagged<InstructionStream> target =
155 InstructionStream::FromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
156 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(target);
157 }
158
159 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
160 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
161 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsEmbeddedObjectMode(rinfo->rmode()));
162 Tagged<HeapObject> target_object = rinfo->target_object(cage_base());
163 Tagged<Code> code = Code::unchecked_cast(host->raw_code(kAcquireLoad));
164 if (!code->IsWeakObject(target_object)) {
165 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(target_object);
166 }
167 }
168
169 private:
170 V8_INLINE void VerifyHeapObjectImpl(Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
171 if (!ShouldVerifyObject(heap_object)) return;
172
173 if (heap_->MustBeInSharedOldSpace(heap_object)) {
174 CHECK(heap_->SharedHeapContains(heap_object));
175 }
176
177 CHECK(InReadOnlySpace(heap_object) ||
178 marking_state_->IsMarked(heap_object));
179 }
180
181 V8_INLINE bool ShouldVerifyObject(Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
182 const bool in_shared_heap = InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object);
183 return heap_->isolate()->is_shared_space_isolate() ? true : !in_shared_heap;
184 }
185
186 template <typename TSlot>
187 V8_INLINE void VerifyPointersImpl(TSlot start, TSlot end) {
188 PtrComprCageBase cage_base =
189 GetPtrComprCageBaseFromOnHeapAddress(start.address());
190 for (TSlot slot = start; slot < end; ++slot) {
191 typename TSlot::TObject object = slot.load(cage_base);
192#ifdef V8_ENABLE_DIRECT_LOCAL
193 if (object.ptr() == kTaggedNullAddress) continue;
194#endif
195 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
196 if (object.GetHeapObjectIfStrong(&heap_object)) {
197 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(heap_object);
198 }
199 }
200 }
201
202 NonAtomicMarkingState* const marking_state_;
203};
204
205} // namespace
206#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
207
208// ==================================================================
209// MarkCompactCollector
210// ==================================================================

212namespace {
213
214int NumberOfAvailableCores() {
215 static int num_cores = V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->NumberOfWorkerThreads() + 1;
216 // This number of cores should be greater than zero and never change.
217 DCHECK_GE(num_cores, 1);
218 DCHECK_EQ(num_cores, V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->NumberOfWorkerThreads() + 1);
219 return num_cores;
220}
221
222int NumberOfParallelCompactionTasks(Heap* heap) {
223 int tasks = v8_flags.parallel_compaction ? NumberOfAvailableCores() : 1;
224 if (!heap->CanPromoteYoungAndExpandOldGeneration(
225 static_cast<size_t>(tasks * PageMetadata::kPageSize))) {
226 // Optimize for memory usage near the heap limit.
227 tasks = 1;
228 }
229 return tasks;
230}
231
232} // namespace
233
234// This visitor is used for marking on the main thread. It is cheaper than
235// the concurrent marking visitor because it does not snapshot JSObjects.
236class MainMarkingVisitor final
237 : public FullMarkingVisitorBase<MainMarkingVisitor> {
238 public:
239 MainMarkingVisitor(MarkingWorklists::Local* local_marking_worklists,
240 WeakObjects::Local* local_weak_objects, Heap* heap,
241 unsigned mark_compact_epoch,
242 base::EnumSet<CodeFlushMode> code_flush_mode,
243 bool trace_embedder_fields,
244 bool should_keep_ages_unchanged,
245 uint16_t code_flushing_increase)
246 : FullMarkingVisitorBase<MainMarkingVisitor>(
247 local_marking_worklists, local_weak_objects, heap,
248 mark_compact_epoch, code_flush_mode, trace_embedder_fields,
249 should_keep_ages_unchanged, code_flushing_increase) {}
250
251 private:
252 // Functions required by MarkingVisitorBase.
253
254 template <typename TSlot>
255 void RecordSlot(Tagged<HeapObject> object, TSlot slot,
256 Tagged<HeapObject> target) {
257 MarkCompactCollector::RecordSlot(object, slot, target);
258 }
259
260 void RecordRelocSlot(Tagged<InstructionStream> host, RelocInfo* rinfo,
261 Tagged<HeapObject> target) {
262 MarkCompactCollector::RecordRelocSlot(host, rinfo, target);
263 }
264
265 TraceRetainingPathMode retaining_path_mode() {
266 return (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.track_retaining_path))
267 ? TraceRetainingPathMode::kEnabled
268 : TraceRetainingPathMode::kDisabled;
269 }
270
271 friend class MarkingVisitorBase<MainMarkingVisitor>;
272};
273
274MarkCompactCollector::MarkCompactCollector(Heap* heap)
275 : heap_(heap),
276#ifdef DEBUG
277 state_(IDLE),
278#endif
279 uses_shared_heap_(heap_->isolate()->has_shared_space()),
280 is_shared_space_isolate_(heap_->isolate()->is_shared_space_isolate()),
281 marking_state_(heap_->marking_state()),
282 non_atomic_marking_state_(heap_->non_atomic_marking_state()),
283 sweeper_(heap_->sweeper()) {
284}
285
286MarkCompactCollector::~MarkCompactCollector() = default;
287
288void MarkCompactCollector::TearDown() {
289 if (heap_->incremental_marking()->IsMajorMarking()) {
290 local_marking_worklists_->Publish();
291 heap_->main_thread_local_heap_->marking_barrier()->PublishIfNeeded();
292 // Marking barriers of LocalHeaps will be published in their destructors.
293 marking_worklists_.Clear();
294 local_weak_objects()->Publish();
295 weak_objects()->Clear();
296 }
297}
298
299void MarkCompactCollector::AddEvacuationCandidate(PageMetadata* p) {
300 DCHECK(!p->Chunk()->NeverEvacuate());
301
302 if (v8_flags.trace_evacuation_candidates) {
303 PrintIsolate(
304 heap_->isolate(),
305 "Evacuation candidate: Free bytes: %6zu. Free Lists length: %4d.\n",
306 p->area_size() - p->allocated_bytes(), p->ComputeFreeListsLength());
307 }
308
309 p->MarkEvacuationCandidate();
310 evacuation_candidates_.push_back(p);
311}
312
313static void TraceFragmentation(PagedSpace* space) {
314 int number_of_pages = space->CountTotalPages();
315 intptr_t reserved = (number_of_pages * space->AreaSize());
316 intptr_t free = reserved - space->SizeOfObjects();
317 PrintF("[%s]: %d pages, %d (%.1f%%) free\n", ToString(space->identity()),
318 number_of_pages, static_cast<int>(free),
319 static_cast<double>(free) * 100 / reserved);
320}
321
322bool MarkCompactCollector::StartCompaction(StartCompactionMode mode) {
323 DCHECK(!compacting_);
324 DCHECK(evacuation_candidates_.empty());
325
326 // Bailouts for completely disabled compaction.
327 if (!v8_flags.compact ||
328 (mode == StartCompactionMode::kAtomic && heap_->IsGCWithStack() &&
329 !v8_flags.compact_with_stack) ||
330 (v8_flags.gc_experiment_less_compaction &&
331 !heap_->ShouldReduceMemory())) {
332 return false;
333 }
334
335 CollectEvacuationCandidates(heap_->old_space());
336
337 if (heap_->shared_space()) {
338 CollectEvacuationCandidates(heap_->shared_space());
339 }
340
341 CollectEvacuationCandidates(heap_->trusted_space());
342
343 if (heap_->isolate()->AllowsCodeCompaction() &&
344 (!heap_->IsGCWithStack() || v8_flags.compact_code_space_with_stack)) {
345 CollectEvacuationCandidates(heap_->code_space());
346 } else if (v8_flags.trace_fragmentation) {
347 TraceFragmentation(heap_->code_space());
348 }
349
350 compacting_ = !evacuation_candidates_.empty();
351 return compacting_;
352}
353
354void MarkCompactCollector::StartMarking() {
355 // The state for background thread is saved here and maintained for the whole
356 // GC cycle. Both CppHeap and regular V8 heap will refer to this flag.
357 use_background_threads_in_cycle_ = heap_->ShouldUseBackgroundThreads();
358
359 if (v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits) {
360 heap()->Unmark();
361 }
362
363#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
364 heap_->young_external_pointer_space()->StartCompactingIfNeeded();
365 heap_->old_external_pointer_space()->StartCompactingIfNeeded();
366 heap_->cpp_heap_pointer_space()->StartCompactingIfNeeded();
367#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
368
369 // CppHeap's marker must be initialized before the V8 marker to allow
370 // exchanging of worklists.
371 if (heap_->cpp_heap()) {
372 TRACE_GC(heap()->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_EMBEDDER_PROLOGUE);
373 CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap())
374 ->InitializeMarking(CppHeap::CollectionType::kMajor);
375 }
376
377 std::vector<Address> contexts =
378 heap_->memory_measurement()->StartProcessing();
379 if (v8_flags.stress_per_context_marking_worklist) {
380 contexts.clear();
381 HandleScope handle_scope(heap_->isolate());
382 for (auto context : heap_->FindAllNativeContexts()) {
383 contexts.push_back(context->ptr());
384 }
385 }
386 heap_->tracer()->NotifyMarkingStart();
387 code_flush_mode_ = Heap::GetCodeFlushMode(heap_->isolate());
388 marking_worklists_.CreateContextWorklists(contexts);
389 auto* cpp_heap = CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap_);
390 local_marking_worklists_ = std::make_unique<MarkingWorklists::Local>(
391 &marking_worklists_,
392 cpp_heap ? cpp_heap->CreateCppMarkingStateForMutatorThread()
393 : MarkingWorklists::Local::kNoCppMarkingState);
394 local_weak_objects_ = std::make_unique<WeakObjects::Local>(weak_objects());
395 marking_visitor_ = std::make_unique<MainMarkingVisitor>(
396 local_marking_worklists_.get(), local_weak_objects_.get(), heap_, epoch(),
397 code_flush_mode(),
398 cpp_heap && local_marking_worklists_->cpp_marking_state()
399 ->SupportsWrappableExtraction(),
400 heap_->ShouldCurrentGCKeepAgesUnchanged(),
401 heap_->tracer()->CodeFlushingIncrease());
402 // This method evicts SFIs with flushed bytecode from the cache before
403 // iterating the compilation cache as part of the root set. SFIs that get
404 // flushed in this GC cycle will get evicted out of the cache in the next GC
405 // cycle. The SFI will remain in the cache until then and may remain in the
406 // cache even longer in case the SFI is re-compiled.
407 heap_->isolate()->compilation_cache()->MarkCompactPrologue();
408 // Marking bits are cleared by the sweeper or unmarker (if sticky mark-bits
409 // are enabled).
410#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
411 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) {
412 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean();
413 }
414#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
415}
416
417void MarkCompactCollector::MaybeEnableBackgroundThreadsInCycle() {
418 if (v8_flags.concurrent_marking && !use_background_threads_in_cycle_) {
419 use_background_threads_in_cycle_ = heap()->ShouldUseBackgroundThreads();
420 if (use_background_threads_in_cycle_) {
421 heap_->concurrent_marking()->RescheduleJobIfNeeded(
422 GarbageCollector::MARK_COMPACTOR);
423
424 if (auto* cpp_heap = CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap_)) {
425 cpp_heap->ReEnableConcurrentMarking();
426 }
427 }
428 }
429}
430
431void MarkCompactCollector::CollectGarbage() {
432 // Make sure that Prepare() has been called. The individual steps below will
433 // update the state as they proceed.
434 DCHECK(state_ == PREPARE_GC);
435
436 MaybeEnableBackgroundThreadsInCycle();
437
438 MarkLiveObjects();
439 // This will walk dead object graphs and so requires that all references are
440 // still intact.
441 RecordObjectStats();
442 ClearNonLiveReferences();
443 VerifyMarking();
444 heap_->memory_measurement()->FinishProcessing(native_context_stats_);
445
446 Sweep();
447 Evacuate();
448 Finish();
449}
450
451#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
452
453void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(PagedSpaceBase* space) {
454 for (PageMetadata* p : *space) {
455 CHECK(p->marking_bitmap()->IsClean());
456 CHECK_EQ(0, p->live_bytes());
457 }
458}
459
460void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(NewSpace* space) {
461 if (!space) return;
462 if (v8_flags.minor_ms) {
463 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(PagedNewSpace::From(space)->paged_space());
464 return;
465 }
466 for (PageMetadata* p : *space) {
467 CHECK(p->marking_bitmap()->IsClean());
468 CHECK_EQ(0, p->live_bytes());
469 }
470}
471
472void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(LargeObjectSpace* space) {
473 if (!space) return;
474 LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator it(space);
475 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj = it.Next(); !obj.is_null(); obj = it.Next()) {
476 CHECK(non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(obj));
477 CHECK_EQ(0, MutablePageMetadata::FromHeapObject(obj)->live_bytes());
478 }
479}
480
481void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean() {
482 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->old_space());
483 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->code_space());
484 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->new_space());
485 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->lo_space());
486 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->code_lo_space());
487 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->new_lo_space());
488 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->trusted_space());
489 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->trusted_lo_space());
490}
491
492#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
493
494void MarkCompactCollector::ComputeEvacuationHeuristics(
495 size_t area_size, int* target_fragmentation_percent,
496 size_t* max_evacuated_bytes) {
497 // For memory reducing and optimize for memory mode we directly define both
498 // constants.
499 const int kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory = 20;
500 const size_t kMaxEvacuatedBytesForReduceMemory =
501 (v8_flags.minor_ms ? 24 : 12) * MB;
502 const int kTargetFragmentationPercentForOptimizeMemory = 20;
503 const size_t kMaxEvacuatedBytesForOptimizeMemory = 6 * MB;
504
505 // For regular mode (which is latency critical) we define less aggressive
506 // defaults to start and switch to a trace-based (using compaction speed)
507 // approach as soon as we have enough samples.
508 const int kTargetFragmentationPercent = 70;
509 const size_t kMaxEvacuatedBytes = 4 * MB;
510 // Time to take for a single area (=payload of page). Used as soon as there
511 // exist enough compaction speed samples.
512 const float kTargetMsPerArea = .5;
513
514 if (heap_->ShouldReduceMemory()) {
515 *target_fragmentation_percent = kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory;
516 *max_evacuated_bytes = kMaxEvacuatedBytesForReduceMemory;
517 } else if (heap_->ShouldOptimizeForMemoryUsage()) {
518 *target_fragmentation_percent =
519 kTargetFragmentationPercentForOptimizeMemory;
520 *max_evacuated_bytes = kMaxEvacuatedBytesForOptimizeMemory;
521 } else {
522 const double estimated_compaction_speed =
523 heap_->tracer()->CompactionSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond();
524 if (estimated_compaction_speed != 0) {
525 // Estimate the target fragmentation based on traced compaction speed
526 // and a goal for a single page.
527 const double estimated_ms_per_area =
528 1 + area_size / estimated_compaction_speed;
529 *target_fragmentation_percent = static_cast<int>(
530 100 - 100 * kTargetMsPerArea / estimated_ms_per_area);
531 if (*target_fragmentation_percent <
532 kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory) {
533 *target_fragmentation_percent =
534 kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory;
535 }
536 } else {
537 *target_fragmentation_percent = kTargetFragmentationPercent;
538 }
539 *max_evacuated_bytes = kMaxEvacuatedBytes;
540 }
541}
542
543void MarkCompactCollector::CollectEvacuationCandidates(PagedSpace* space) {
544 DCHECK(space->identity() == OLD_SPACE || space->identity() == CODE_SPACE ||
545 space->identity() == SHARED_SPACE ||
546 space->identity() == TRUSTED_SPACE);
547
548 int number_of_pages = space->CountTotalPages();
549 size_t area_size = space->AreaSize();
550
551 const bool in_standard_path =
552 !(v8_flags.manual_evacuation_candidates_selection ||
553 v8_flags.stress_compaction_random || v8_flags.stress_compaction ||
554 v8_flags.compact_on_every_full_gc);
555 // Those variables will only be initialized if |in_standard_path|, and are not
556 // used otherwise.
557 size_t max_evacuated_bytes;
558 int target_fragmentation_percent;
559 size_t free_bytes_threshold;
560 if (in_standard_path) {
561 // We use two conditions to decide whether a page qualifies as an evacuation
562 // candidate, or not:
563 // * Target fragmentation: How fragmented is a page, i.e., how is the ratio
564 // between live bytes and capacity of this page (= area).
565 // * Evacuation quota: A global quota determining how much bytes should be
566 // compacted.
567 ComputeEvacuationHeuristics(area_size, &target_fragmentation_percent,
568 &max_evacuated_bytes);
569 free_bytes_threshold = target_fragmentation_percent * (area_size / 100);
570 }
571
572 // Pairs of (live_bytes_in_page, page).
573 using LiveBytesPagePair = std::pair<size_t, PageMetadata*>;
574 std::vector<LiveBytesPagePair> pages;
575 pages.reserve(number_of_pages);
576
577 DCHECK(!sweeper_->sweeping_in_progress());
578 for (PageMetadata* p : *space) {
579 MemoryChunk* chunk = p->Chunk();
580 if (chunk->NeverEvacuate() || !chunk->CanAllocate()) continue;
581
582 if (chunk->IsPinned()) {
583 DCHECK(!chunk->IsFlagSet(
584 MemoryChunk::FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING));
585 continue;
586 }
587
588 // Invariant: Evacuation candidates are just created when marking is
589 // started. This means that sweeping has finished. Furthermore, at the end
590 // of a GC all evacuation candidates are cleared and their slot buffers are
591 // released.
592 CHECK(!chunk->IsEvacuationCandidate());
593 CHECK_NULL(p->slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD>());
594 CHECK_NULL(p->typed_slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD>());
595 CHECK(p->SweepingDone());
596 DCHECK(p->area_size() == area_size);
597 if (in_standard_path) {
598 // Only the pages with at more than |free_bytes_threshold| free bytes are
599 // considered for evacuation.
600 if (area_size - p->allocated_bytes() >= free_bytes_threshold) {
601 pages.push_back(std::make_pair(p->allocated_bytes(), p));
602 }
603 } else {
604 pages.push_back(std::make_pair(p->allocated_bytes(), p));
605 }
606 }
607
608 int candidate_count = 0;
609 size_t total_live_bytes = 0;
610
611 const bool reduce_memory = heap_->ShouldReduceMemory();
612 if (v8_flags.manual_evacuation_candidates_selection) {
613 for (size_t i = 0; i < pages.size(); i++) {
614 PageMetadata* p = pages[i].second;
615 MemoryChunk* chunk = p->Chunk();
616 if (chunk->IsFlagSet(
617 MemoryChunk::FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING)) {
618 candidate_count++;
619 total_live_bytes += pages[i].first;
620 chunk->ClearFlagSlow(
621 MemoryChunk::FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING);
622 AddEvacuationCandidate(p);
623 }
624 }
625 } else if (v8_flags.stress_compaction_random) {
626 double fraction = heap_->isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextDouble();
627 size_t pages_to_mark_count =
628 static_cast<size_t>(fraction * (pages.size() + 1));
629 for (uint64_t i : heap_->isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextSample(
630 pages.size(), pages_to_mark_count)) {
631 candidate_count++;
632 total_live_bytes += pages[i].first;
633 AddEvacuationCandidate(pages[i].second);
634 }
635 } else if (v8_flags.stress_compaction) {
636 for (size_t i = 0; i < pages.size(); i++) {
637 PageMetadata* p = pages[i].second;
638 if (i % 2 == 0) {
639 candidate_count++;
640 total_live_bytes += pages[i].first;
641 AddEvacuationCandidate(p);
642 }
643 }
644 } else {
645 // The following approach determines the pages that should be evacuated.
646 //
647 // Sort pages from the most free to the least free, then select
648 // the first n pages for evacuation such that:
649 // - the total size of evacuated objects does not exceed the specified
650 // limit.
651 // - fragmentation of (n+1)-th page does not exceed the specified limit.
652 std::sort(pages.begin(), pages.end(),
653 [](const LiveBytesPagePair& a, const LiveBytesPagePair& b) {
654 return a.first < b.first;
655 });
656 for (size_t i = 0; i < pages.size(); i++) {
657 size_t live_bytes = pages[i].first;
658 DCHECK_GE(area_size, live_bytes);
659 if (v8_flags.compact_on_every_full_gc ||
660 ((total_live_bytes + live_bytes) <= max_evacuated_bytes)) {
661 candidate_count++;
662 total_live_bytes += live_bytes;
663 }
664 if (v8_flags.trace_fragmentation_verbose) {
665 PrintIsolate(heap_->isolate(),
666 "compaction-selection-page: space=%s free_bytes_page=%zu "
667 "fragmentation_limit_kb=%zu "
668 "fragmentation_limit_percent=%d sum_compaction_kb=%zu "
669 "compaction_limit_kb=%zu\n",
670 ToString(space->identity()), (area_size - live_bytes) / KB,
671 free_bytes_threshold / KB, target_fragmentation_percent,
672 total_live_bytes / KB, max_evacuated_bytes / KB);
673 }
674 }
675 // How many pages we will allocated for the evacuated objects
676 // in the worst case: ceil(total_live_bytes / area_size)
677 int estimated_new_pages =
678 static_cast<int>((total_live_bytes + area_size - 1) / area_size);
679 DCHECK_LE(estimated_new_pages, candidate_count);
680 int estimated_released_pages = candidate_count - estimated_new_pages;
681 // Avoid (compact -> expand) cycles.
682 if ((estimated_released_pages == 0) && !v8_flags.compact_on_every_full_gc) {
683 candidate_count = 0;
684 }
685 for (int i = 0; i < candidate_count; i++) {
686 AddEvacuationCandidate(pages[i].second);
687 }
688 }
689
690 if (v8_flags.trace_fragmentation) {
691 PrintIsolate(heap_->isolate(),
692 "compaction-selection: space=%s reduce_memory=%d pages=%d "
693 "total_live_bytes=%zu\n",
694 ToString(space->identity()), reduce_memory, candidate_count,
695 total_live_bytes / KB);
696 }
697}
698
699void MarkCompactCollector::Prepare() {
700#ifdef DEBUG
701 DCHECK(state_ == IDLE);
702 state_ = PREPARE_GC;
703#endif
704
705 DCHECK(!sweeper_->sweeping_in_progress());
706
707 DCHECK_IMPLIES(heap_->incremental_marking()->IsMarking(),
708 heap_->incremental_marking()->IsMajorMarking());
709 if (!heap_->incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
710 StartCompaction(StartCompactionMode::kAtomic);
711 StartMarking();
712 if (heap_->cpp_heap_) {
713 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_EMBEDDER_PROLOGUE);
714 // StartTracing immediately starts marking which requires V8 worklists to
715 // be set up.
716 CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap_)->StartMarking();
717 }
718 }
719
720 if (heap_->use_new_space()) {
721 DCHECK_EQ(
722 heap_->allocator()->new_space_allocator()->top(),
723 heap_->allocator()->new_space_allocator()->original_top_acquire());
724 }
725}
726
727void MarkCompactCollector::FinishConcurrentMarking() {
728 // FinishConcurrentMarking is called for both, concurrent and parallel,
729 // marking. It is safe to call this function when tasks are already finished.
730 DCHECK_EQ(heap_->concurrent_marking()->garbage_collector(),
731 GarbageCollector::MARK_COMPACTOR);
732 if (v8_flags.parallel_marking || v8_flags.concurrent_marking) {
733 heap_->concurrent_marking()->Join();
734 heap_->concurrent_marking()->FlushMemoryChunkData();
735 heap_->concurrent_marking()->FlushNativeContexts(&native_context_stats_);
736 }
737 if (auto* cpp_heap = CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap_)) {
738 cpp_heap->FinishConcurrentMarkingIfNeeded();
739 }
740}
741
742void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarking() {
743 CHECK(local_marking_worklists_->IsEmpty());
744 DCHECK(heap_->incremental_marking()->IsStopped());
745#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
746 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) {
747 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_VERIFY);
748 FullMarkingVerifier verifier(heap_);
749 verifier.Run();
750 heap_->old_space()->VerifyLiveBytes();
751 heap_->code_space()->VerifyLiveBytes();
752 if (heap_->shared_space()) heap_->shared_space()->VerifyLiveBytes();
753 heap_->trusted_space()->VerifyLiveBytes();
754 if (v8_flags.minor_ms && heap_->paged_new_space())
755 heap_->paged_new_space()->paged_space()->VerifyLiveBytes();
756 }
757#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
758}
759
760namespace {
761
762void ShrinkPagesToObjectSizes(Heap* heap, OldLargeObjectSpace* space) {
763 size_t surviving_object_size = 0;
764 PtrComprCageBase cage_base(heap->isolate());
765 for (auto it = space->begin(); it != space->end();) {
766 LargePageMetadata* current = *(it++);
767 Tagged<HeapObject> object = current->GetObject();
768 const size_t object_size = static_cast<size_t>(object->Size(cage_base));
769 space->ShrinkPageToObjectSize(current, object, object_size);
770 surviving_object_size += object_size;
771 }
772 space->set_objects_size(surviving_object_size);
773}
774
775} // namespace
776
777void MarkCompactCollector::Finish() {
778 {
779 TRACE_GC_EPOCH_WITH_FLOW(
780 heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP, ThreadKind::kMain,
781 sweeper_->GetTraceIdForFlowEvent(GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP),
782 TRACE_EVENT_FLAG_FLOW_IN | TRACE_EVENT_FLAG_FLOW_OUT);
783
784 // Delay releasing empty new space pages and dead new large object pages
785 // until after pointer updating is done because dead old space objects may
786 // have slots pointing to these pages and will need to be updated.
787 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!v8_flags.minor_ms,
788 empty_new_space_pages_to_be_swept_.empty());
789 if (!empty_new_space_pages_to_be_swept_.empty()) {
790 GCTracer::Scope sweep_scope(
791 heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP_NEW, ThreadKind::kMain);
792 for (PageMetadata* p : empty_new_space_pages_to_be_swept_) {
793 // Sweeping empty pages already relinks them to the freelist.
794 sweeper_->SweepEmptyNewSpacePage(p);
795 }
796 empty_new_space_pages_to_be_swept_.clear();
797 }
798
799 if (heap_->new_lo_space()) {
800 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP_NEW_LO);
801 SweepLargeSpace(heap_->new_lo_space());
802 }
803
804#ifdef DEBUG
805 heap_->VerifyCountersBeforeConcurrentSweeping(
806 GarbageCollector::MARK_COMPACTOR);
807#endif // DEBUG
808 }
809
810 if (heap_->new_space()) {
811 if (v8_flags.minor_ms) {
812 switch (resize_new_space_) {
813 case ResizeNewSpaceMode::kShrink:
814 heap_->ReduceNewSpaceSize();
815 break;
816 case ResizeNewSpaceMode::kGrow:
817 heap_->ExpandNewSpaceSize();
818 break;
819 case ResizeNewSpaceMode::kNone:
820 break;
821 }
822 resize_new_space_ = ResizeNewSpaceMode::kNone;
823 }
824 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_EVACUATE);
825 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_EVACUATE_REBALANCE);
826 if (!heap_->new_space()->EnsureCurrentCapacity()) {
827 heap_->FatalProcessOutOfMemory("NewSpace::EnsureCurrentCapacity");
828 }
829 }
830
831 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_FINISH);
832
833 if (heap_->new_space()) {
834 DCHECK(!heap_->allocator()->new_space_allocator()->IsLabValid());
835 heap_->new_space()->GarbageCollectionEpilogue();
836 }
837
838 auto* isolate = heap_->isolate();
839 isolate->global_handles()->ClearListOfYoungNodes();
840
841 SweepArrayBufferExtensions();
842
843 marking_visitor_.reset();
844 local_marking_worklists_.reset();
845 marking_worklists_.ReleaseContextWorklists();
846 native_context_stats_.Clear();
847
848 CHECK(weak_objects_.current_ephemerons.IsEmpty());
849 CHECK(weak_objects_.discovered_ephemerons.IsEmpty());
850 local_weak_objects_->next_ephemerons_local.Publish();
851 local_weak_objects_.reset();
852 weak_objects_.next_ephemerons.Clear();
853
854 sweeper_->StartMajorSweeperTasks();
855
856 // Release empty pages now, when the pointer-update phase is done.
857 heap_->memory_allocator()->ReleaseQueuedPages();
858
859 // Shrink pages if possible after processing and filtering slots.
860 ShrinkPagesToObjectSizes(heap_, heap_->lo_space());
861
862#ifdef DEBUG
863 DCHECK(state_ == SWEEP_SPACES || state_ == RELOCATE_OBJECTS);
864 state_ = IDLE;
865#endif
866
867 if (have_code_to_deoptimize_) {
868 // Some code objects were marked for deoptimization during the GC.
869 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeMarkedCode(isolate);
870 have_code_to_deoptimize_ = false;
871 }
872}
873
874void MarkCompactCollector::SweepArrayBufferExtensions() {
875 DCHECK_IMPLIES(heap_->new_space(), heap_->new_space()->Size() == 0);
876 DCHECK_IMPLIES(heap_->new_lo_space(), heap_->new_lo_space()->Size() == 0);
877 heap_->array_buffer_sweeper()->RequestSweep(
878 ArrayBufferSweeper::SweepingType::kFull,
879 ArrayBufferSweeper::TreatAllYoungAsPromoted::kYes);
880}
881
882void MarkCompactCollector::MarkRootObject(Root root, Tagged<HeapObject> obj) {
883 DCHECK(ReadOnlyHeap::Contains(obj) || heap_->Contains(obj));
884 if (marking_state_->TryMark(obj)) {
885 local_marking_worklists_->Push(obj);
886 if (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.track_retaining_path)) {
887 heap_->AddRetainingRoot(root, obj);
888 }
889 }
890}
891
892bool MarkCompactCollector::ShouldMarkObject(Tagged<HeapObject> object) const {
893 if (InReadOnlySpace(object)) return false;
894 if (V8_LIKELY(!uses_shared_heap_)) return true;
895 if (is_shared_space_isolate_) return true;
896 return !InAnySharedSpace(object);
897}
898
899class MarkCompactCollector::RootMarkingVisitor final : public RootVisitor {
900 public:
901 explicit RootMarkingVisitor(MarkCompactCollector* collector)
902 : collector_(collector) {}
903
904 void VisitRootPointer(Root root, const char* description,
905 FullObjectSlot p) final {
906 DCHECK(!MapWord::IsPacked(p.Relaxed_Load().ptr()));
907 MarkObjectByPointer(root, p);
908 }
909
910 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
911 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) final {
912 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
913 MarkObjectByPointer(root, p);
914 }
915 }
916
917 // Keep this synced with RootsReferencesExtractor::VisitRunningCode.
918 void VisitRunningCode(FullObjectSlot code_slot,
919 FullObjectSlot istream_or_smi_zero_slot) final {
920 Tagged<Object> istream_or_smi_zero = *istream_or_smi_zero_slot;
921 DCHECK(istream_or_smi_zero == Smi::zero() ||
922 IsInstructionStream(istream_or_smi_zero));
923 Tagged<Code> code = Code::cast(*code_slot);
924 DCHECK_EQ(code->raw_instruction_stream(PtrComprCageBase{
925 collector_->heap_->isolate()->code_cage_base()}),
926 istream_or_smi_zero);
927
928 // We must not remove deoptimization literals which may be needed in
929 // order to successfully deoptimize.
930 code->IterateDeoptimizationLiterals(this);
931
932 if (istream_or_smi_zero != Smi::zero()) {
933 VisitRootPointer(Root::kStackRoots, nullptr, istream_or_smi_zero_slot);
934 }
935
936 VisitRootPointer(Root::kStackRoots, nullptr, code_slot);
937 }
938
939 private:
940 V8_INLINE void MarkObjectByPointer(Root root, FullObjectSlot p) {
941 Tagged<Object> object = *p;
942#ifdef V8_ENABLE_DIRECT_LOCAL
943 if (object.ptr() == kTaggedNullAddress) return;
944#endif
945 if (!IsHeapObject(object)) return;
946 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(object);
947 if (!collector_->ShouldMarkObject(heap_object)) return;
948 collector_->MarkRootObject(root, heap_object);
949 }
950
951 MarkCompactCollector* const collector_;
952};
953
954// This visitor is used to visit the body of special objects held alive by
955// other roots.
956//
957// It is currently used for
958// - InstructionStream held alive by the top optimized frame. This code cannot
959// be deoptimized and thus have to be kept alive in an isolate way, i.e., it
960// should not keep alive other code objects reachable through the weak list but
961// they should keep alive its embedded pointers (which would otherwise be
962// dropped).
963// - Prefix of the string table.
964// - If V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX, client Isolates' waiter queue node
965// ExternalPointer_t in shared Isolates.
966class MarkCompactCollector::CustomRootBodyMarkingVisitor final
967 : public ObjectVisitorWithCageBases {
968 public:
969 explicit CustomRootBodyMarkingVisitor(MarkCompactCollector* collector)
970 : ObjectVisitorWithCageBases(collector->heap_->isolate()),
971 collector_(collector) {}
972
973 void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot p) final {
974 MarkObject(host, p.load(cage_base()));
975 }
976
977 void VisitMapPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host) final {
978 MarkObject(host, host->map(cage_base()));
979 }
980
981 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot start,
982 ObjectSlot end) final {
983 for (ObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
984 // The map slot should be handled in VisitMapPointer.
985 DCHECK_NE(host->map_slot(), p);
986 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(p.load(cage_base())));
987 MarkObject(host, p.load(cage_base()));
988 }
989 }
990
991 void VisitInstructionStreamPointer(Tagged<Code> host,
992 InstructionStreamSlot slot) override {
993 MarkObject(host, slot.load(code_cage_base()));
994 }
995
996 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
997 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
998 // At the moment, custom roots cannot contain weak pointers.
999 UNREACHABLE();
1000 }
1001
1002 void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1003 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1004 Tagged<InstructionStream> target =
1005 InstructionStream::FromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
1006 MarkObject(host, target);
1007 }
1008
1009 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1010 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1011 MarkObject(host, rinfo->target_object(cage_base()));
1012 }
1013
1014 private:
1015 V8_INLINE void MarkObject(Tagged<HeapObject> host, Tagged<Object> object) {
1016 if (!IsHeapObject(object)) return;
1017 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(object);
1018 if (!collector_->ShouldMarkObject(heap_object)) return;
1019 collector_->MarkObject(host, heap_object);
1020 }
1021
1022 MarkCompactCollector* const collector_;
1023};
1024
1025class MarkCompactCollector::SharedHeapObjectVisitor final
1026 : public ObjectVisitorWithCageBases {
1027 public:
1028 explicit SharedHeapObjectVisitor(MarkCompactCollector* collector)
1029 : ObjectVisitorWithCageBases(collector->heap_->isolate()),
1030 collector_(collector) {}
1031
1032 void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot p) final {
1033 CheckForSharedObject(host, p, p.load(cage_base()));
1034 }
1035
1036 void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot p) final {
1037 Tagged<MaybeObject> object = p.load(cage_base());
1038 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
1039 if (object.GetHeapObject(&heap_object))
1040 CheckForSharedObject(host, ObjectSlot(p), heap_object);
1041 }
1042
1043 void VisitMapPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host) final {
1044 CheckForSharedObject(host, host->map_slot(), host->map(cage_base()));
1045 }
1046
1047 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot start,
1048 ObjectSlot end) final {
1049 for (ObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
1050 // The map slot should be handled in VisitMapPointer.
1051 DCHECK_NE(host->map_slot(), p);
1052 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(p.load(cage_base())));
1053 CheckForSharedObject(host, p, p.load(cage_base()));
1054 }
1055 }
1056
1057 void VisitInstructionStreamPointer(Tagged<Code> host,
1058 InstructionStreamSlot slot) override {
1059 UNREACHABLE();
1060 }
1061
1062 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
1063 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
1064 for (MaybeObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
1065 // The map slot should be handled in VisitMapPointer.
1066 DCHECK_NE(host->map_slot(), ObjectSlot(p));
1067 VisitPointer(host, p);
1068 }
1069 }
1070
1071 void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1072 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1073 UNREACHABLE();
1074 }
1075
1076 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1077 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1078 UNREACHABLE();
1079 }
1080
1081 private:
1082 V8_INLINE void CheckForSharedObject(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot slot,
1083 Tagged<Object> object) {
1084 DCHECK(!InAnySharedSpace(host));
1085 if (!IsHeapObject(object)) return;
1086 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(object);
1087 if (!InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object)) return;
1088 DCHECK(InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object));
1089 MemoryChunk* host_chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(host);
1090 MutablePageMetadata* host_page_metadata =
1091 MutablePageMetadata::cast(host_chunk->Metadata());
1092 DCHECK(Heap::InYoungGeneration(host));
1093 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_SHARED>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(
1094 host_page_metadata, host_chunk->Offset(slot.address()));
1095 collector_->MarkRootObject(Root::kClientHeap, heap_object);
1096 }
1097
1098 MarkCompactCollector* const collector_;
1099};
1100
1101class InternalizedStringTableCleaner final : public RootVisitor {
1102 public:
1103 explicit InternalizedStringTableCleaner(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {}
1104
1105 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
1106 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
1107 UNREACHABLE();
1108 }
1109
1110 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
1111 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
1112 OffHeapObjectSlot end) override {
1113 DCHECK_EQ(root, Root::kStringTable);
1114 // Visit all HeapObject pointers in [start, end).
1115 auto* marking_state = heap_->marking_state();
1116 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
1117 for (OffHeapObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
1118 Tagged<Object> o = p.load(isolate);
1119 if (IsHeapObject(o)) {
1120 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(o);
1121 DCHECK(!Heap::InYoungGeneration(heap_object));
1122 if (!InReadOnlySpace(heap_object) &&
1123 marking_state->IsUnmarked(heap_object)) {
1124 pointers_removed_++;
1125 p.store(StringTable::deleted_element());
1126 }
1127 }
1128 }
1129 }
1130
1131 int PointersRemoved() const { return pointers_removed_; }
1132
1133 private:
1134 Heap* heap_;
1135 int pointers_removed_ = 0;
1136};
1137
1138#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
1139class MarkExternalPointerFromExternalStringTable : public RootVisitor {
1140 public:
1141 explicit MarkExternalPointerFromExternalStringTable(
1142 ExternalPointerTable* shared_table, ExternalPointerTable::Space* space)
1143 : visitor(shared_table, space) {}
1144
1145 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
1146 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
1147 // Visit all HeapObject pointers in [start, end).
1148 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
1149 Tagged<Object> o = *p;
1150 if (IsHeapObject(o)) {
1151 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(o);
1152 if (IsExternalString(heap_object)) {
1153 Tagged<ExternalString> string = ExternalString::cast(heap_object);
1154 string->VisitExternalPointers(&visitor);
1155 } else {
1156 // The original external string may have been internalized.
1157 DCHECK(IsThinString(o));
1158 }
1159 }
1160 }
1161 }
1162
1163 private:
1164 class MarkExternalPointerTableVisitor : public ObjectVisitor {
1165 public:
1166 explicit MarkExternalPointerTableVisitor(ExternalPointerTable* table,
1167 ExternalPointerTable::Space* space)
1168 : table_(table), space_(space) {}
1169 void VisitExternalPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
1170 ExternalPointerSlot slot) override {
1171 DCHECK_NE(slot.tag(), kExternalPointerNullTag);
1172 DCHECK(IsSharedExternalPointerType(slot.tag()));
1173 ExternalPointerHandle handle = slot.Relaxed_LoadHandle();
1174 table_->Mark(space_, handle, slot.address());
1175 }
1176 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot start,
1177 ObjectSlot end) override {
1178 UNREACHABLE();
1179 }
1180 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
1181 MaybeObjectSlot end) override {
1182 UNREACHABLE();
1183 }
1184 void VisitInstructionStreamPointer(Tagged<Code> host,
1185 InstructionStreamSlot slot) override {
1186 UNREACHABLE();
1187 }
1188 void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1189 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1190 UNREACHABLE();
1191 }
1192 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1193 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1194 UNREACHABLE();
1195 }
1196
1197 private:
1198 ExternalPointerTable* table_;
1199 ExternalPointerTable::Space* space_;
1200 };
1201
1202 MarkExternalPointerTableVisitor visitor;
1203};
1204#endif
1205
1206// Implementation of WeakObjectRetainer for mark compact GCs. All marked objects
1207// are retained.
1208class MarkCompactWeakObjectRetainer : public WeakObjectRetainer {
1209 public:
1210 explicit MarkCompactWeakObjectRetainer(MarkingState* marking_state)
1211 : marking_state_(marking_state) {}
1212
1213 Tagged<Object> RetainAs(Tagged<Object> object) override {
1214 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = Tagged<HeapObject>::cast(object);
1215 if (marking_state_->IsMarked(heap_object)) {
1216 return object;
1217 } else if (IsAllocationSite(object) &&
1218 !AllocationSite::cast(object)->IsZombie()) {
1219 // "dead" AllocationSites need to live long enough for a traversal of new
1220 // space. These sites get a one-time reprieve.
1221
1222 Tagged<Object> nested = object;
1223 while (IsAllocationSite(nested)) {
1224 Tagged<AllocationSite> current_site = AllocationSite::cast(nested);
1225 // MarkZombie will override the nested_site, read it first before
1226 // marking
1227 nested = current_site->nested_site();
1228 current_site->MarkZombie();
1229 marking_state_->TryMarkAndAccountLiveBytes(current_site);
1230 }
1231
1232 return object;
1233 } else {
1234 return Smi::zero();
1235 }
1236 }
1237
1238 private:
1239 MarkingState* const marking_state_;
1240};
1241
1242class RecordMigratedSlotVisitor : public ObjectVisitorWithCageBases {
1243 public:
1244 explicit RecordMigratedSlotVisitor(Heap* heap)
1245 : ObjectVisitorWithCageBases(heap->isolate()), heap_(heap) {}
1246
1247 inline void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot p) final {
1248 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(p.load(cage_base())));
1249 RecordMigratedSlot(host, p.load(cage_base()), p.address());
1250 }
1251
1252 inline void VisitMapPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host) final {
1253 VisitPointer(host, host->map_slot());
1254 }
1255
1256 inline void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot p) final {
1257 DCHECK(!MapWord::IsPacked(p.Relaxed_Load(cage_base()).ptr()));
1258 RecordMigratedSlot(host, p.load(cage_base()), p.address());
1259 }
1260
1261 inline void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot start,
1262 ObjectSlot end) final {
1263 while (start < end) {
1264 VisitPointer(host, start);
1265 ++start;
1266 }
1267 }
1268
1269 inline void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
1270 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
1271 while (start < end) {
1272 VisitPointer(host, start);
1273 ++start;
1274 }
1275 }
1276
1277 inline void VisitInstructionStreamPointer(Tagged<Code> host,
1278 InstructionStreamSlot slot) final {
1279 // This code is similar to the implementation of VisitPointer() modulo
1280 // new kind of slot.
1281 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(slot.load(code_cage_base())));
1282 Tagged<Object> code = slot.load(code_cage_base());
1283 RecordMigratedSlot(host, code, slot.address());
1284 }
1285
1286 inline void VisitEphemeron(Tagged<HeapObject> host, int index, ObjectSlot key,
1287 ObjectSlot value) override {
1288 DCHECK(IsEphemeronHashTable(host));
1289 DCHECK(!Heap::InYoungGeneration(host));
1290
1291 // Simply record ephemeron keys in OLD_TO_NEW if it points into the young
1292 // generation instead of recording it in ephemeron_remembered_set here for
1293 // migrated objects. OLD_TO_NEW is per page and we can therefore easily
1294 // record in OLD_TO_NEW on different pages in parallel without merging. Both
1295 // sets are anyways guaranteed to be empty after a full GC.
1296 VisitPointer(host, key);
1297 VisitPointer(host, value);
1298 }
1299
1300 inline void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1301 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1302 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsCodeTargetMode(rinfo->rmode()));
1303 Tagged<InstructionStream> target =
1304 InstructionStream::FromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
1305 // The target is always in old space, we don't have to record the slot in
1306 // the old-to-new remembered set.
1307 DCHECK(!Heap::InYoungGeneration(target));
1308 DCHECK(!InWritableSharedSpace(target));
1309 heap_->mark_compact_collector()->RecordRelocSlot(host, rinfo, target);
1310 }
1311
1312 inline void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1313 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
1314 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsEmbeddedObjectMode(rinfo->rmode()));
1315 Tagged<HeapObject> object = rinfo->target_object(cage_base());
1316 GenerationalBarrierForCode(host, rinfo, object);
1317 WriteBarrier::Shared(host, rinfo, object);
1318 heap_->mark_compact_collector()->RecordRelocSlot(host, rinfo, object);
1319 }
1320
1321 // Entries that are skipped for recording.
1322 inline void VisitExternalReference(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1323 RelocInfo* rinfo) final {}
1324 inline void VisitInternalReference(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
1325 RelocInfo* rinfo) final {}
1326 inline void VisitExternalPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
1327 ExternalPointerSlot slot) final {}
1328
1329 inline void VisitIndirectPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
1330 IndirectPointerSlot slot,
1331 IndirectPointerMode mode) final {}
1332
1333 inline void VisitTrustedPointerTableEntry(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
1334 IndirectPointerSlot slot) final {}
1335
1336 inline void VisitProtectedPointer(Tagged<TrustedObject> host,
1337 ProtectedPointerSlot slot) final {
1338 RecordMigratedSlot(host, slot.load(), slot.address());
1339 }
1340
1341 protected:
1342 inline void RecordMigratedSlot(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
1343 Tagged<MaybeObject> value, Address slot) {
1344 if (value.IsStrongOrWeak()) {
1345 MemoryChunk* value_chunk = MemoryChunk::FromAddress(value.ptr());
1346 MemoryChunk* host_chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(host);
1347 if (Heap::InYoungGeneration(value)) {
1348 MutablePageMetadata* host_metadata =
1349 MutablePageMetadata::cast(host_chunk->Metadata());
1350 DCHECK_IMPLIES(value_chunk->IsToPage(),
1351 v8_flags.minor_ms || value_chunk->IsLargePage());
1352 DCHECK(host_metadata->SweepingDone());
1353 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(
1354 host_metadata, host_chunk->Offset(slot));
1355 } else if (value_chunk->IsEvacuationCandidate()) {
1356 MutablePageMetadata* host_metadata =
1357 MutablePageMetadata::cast(host_chunk->Metadata());
1358 if (value_chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::IS_EXECUTABLE)) {
1359 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_CODE>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(
1360 host_metadata, host_chunk->Offset(slot));
1361 } else if (value_chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::IS_TRUSTED) &&
1362 host_chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::IS_TRUSTED)) {
1363 // When the sandbox is disabled, we use plain tagged pointers to
1364 // reference trusted objects from untrusted ones. However, for these
1365 // references we want to use the OLD_TO_OLD remembered set, so here
1366 // we need to check that both the value chunk and the host chunk are
1367 // trusted space chunks.
1368 RememberedSet<TRUSTED_TO_TRUSTED>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(
1369 host_metadata, host_chunk->Offset(slot));
1370 } else {
1371 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(
1372 host_metadata, host_chunk->Offset(slot));
1373 }
1374 } else if (value_chunk->InWritableSharedSpace() &&
1375 !InWritableSharedSpace(host)) {
1376 MutablePageMetadata* host_metadata =
1377 MutablePageMetadata::cast(host_chunk->Metadata());
1378 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_SHARED>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(
1379 host_metadata, host_chunk->Offset(slot));
1380 }
1381 }
1382 }
1383
1384 Heap* const heap_;
1385};
1386
1387class MigrationObserver {
1388 public:
1389 explicit MigrationObserver(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {}
1390
1391 virtual ~MigrationObserver() = default;
1392 virtual void Move(AllocationSpace dest, Tagged<HeapObject> src,
1393 Tagged<HeapObject> dst, int size) = 0;
1394
1395 protected:
1396 Heap* heap_;
1397};
1398
1399class ProfilingMigrationObserver final : public MigrationObserver {
1400 public:
1401 explicit ProfilingMigrationObserver(Heap* heap) : MigrationObserver(heap) {}
1402
1403 inline void Move(AllocationSpace dest, Tagged<HeapObject> src,
1404 Tagged<HeapObject> dst, int size) final {
1405 // Note this method is called in a concurrent setting. The current object
1406 // (src and dst) is somewhat safe to access without precautions, but other
1407 // objects may be subject to concurrent modification.
1408 if (dest == CODE_SPACE) {
1409 PROFILE(heap_->isolate(), CodeMoveEvent(InstructionStream::cast(src),
1410 InstructionStream::cast(dst)));
1411 } else if ((dest == OLD_SPACE || dest == TRUSTED_SPACE) &&
1412 IsBytecodeArray(dst)) {
1413 // TODO(saelo): remove `dest == OLD_SPACE` once BytecodeArrays are
1414 // allocated in trusted space.
1415 PROFILE(heap_->isolate(), BytecodeMoveEvent(BytecodeArray::cast(src),
1416 BytecodeArray::cast(dst)));
1417 }
1418 heap_->OnMoveEvent(src, dst, size);
1419 }
1420};
1421
1422class HeapObjectVisitor {
1423 public:
1424 virtual ~HeapObjectVisitor() = default;
1425 virtual bool Visit(Tagged<HeapObject> object, int size) = 0;
1426};
1427
1428class EvacuateVisitorBase : public HeapObjectVisitor {
1429 public:
1430 void AddObserver(MigrationObserver* observer) {
1431 migration_function_ = RawMigrateObject<MigrationMode::kObserved>;
1432 observers_.push_back(observer);
1433 }
1434
1435#if DEBUG
1436 void DisableAbortEvacuationAtAddress(MutablePageMetadata* chunk) {
1437 abort_evacuation_at_address_ = chunk->area_end();
1438 }
1439
1440 void SetUpAbortEvacuationAtAddress(MutablePageMetadata* chunk) {
1441 if (v8_flags.stress_compaction || v8_flags.stress_compaction_random) {
1442 // Stress aborting of evacuation by aborting ~5% of evacuation candidates
1443 // when stress testing.
1444 const double kFraction = 0.05;
1445
1446 if (rng_->NextDouble() < kFraction) {
1447 const double abort_evacuation_percentage = rng_->NextDouble();
1448 abort_evacuation_at_address_ =
1449 chunk->area_start() +
1450 abort_evacuation_percentage * chunk->area_size();
1451 return;
1452 }
1453 }
1454
1455 abort_evacuation_at_address_ = chunk->area_end();
1456 }
1457#endif // DEBUG
1458
1459 protected:
1460 enum MigrationMode { kFast, kObserved };
1461
1462 PtrComprCageBase cage_base() {
1463#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
1464 return PtrComprCageBase{heap_->isolate()};
1465#else
1466 return PtrComprCageBase{};
1467#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
1468 }
1469
1470 using MigrateFunction = void (*)(EvacuateVisitorBase* base,
1471 Tagged<HeapObject> dst,
1472 Tagged<HeapObject> src, int size,
1473 AllocationSpace dest);
1474
1475 template <MigrationMode mode>
1476 static void RawMigrateObject(EvacuateVisitorBase* base,
1477 Tagged<HeapObject> dst, Tagged<HeapObject> src,
1478 int size, AllocationSpace dest) {
1479 Address dst_addr = dst.address();
1480 Address src_addr = src.address();
1481 PtrComprCageBase cage_base = base->cage_base();
1482 DCHECK(base->heap_->AllowedToBeMigrated(src->map(cage_base), src, dest));
1483 DCHECK_NE(dest, LO_SPACE);
1484 DCHECK_NE(dest, CODE_LO_SPACE);
1485 DCHECK_NE(dest, TRUSTED_LO_SPACE);
1486 if (dest == OLD_SPACE) {
1487 DCHECK_OBJECT_SIZE(size);
1488 DCHECK(IsAligned(size, kTaggedSize));
1489 base->heap_->CopyBlock(dst_addr, src_addr, size);
1490 if (mode != MigrationMode::kFast) {
1491 base->ExecuteMigrationObservers(dest, src, dst, size);
1492 }
1493 // In case the object's map gets relocated during GC we load the old map
1494 // here. This is fine since they store the same content.
1495 dst->IterateFast(dst->map(cage_base), size, base->record_visitor_);
1496 } else if (dest == SHARED_SPACE) {
1497 DCHECK_OBJECT_SIZE(size);
1498 DCHECK(IsAligned(size, kTaggedSize));
1499 base->heap_->CopyBlock(dst_addr, src_addr, size);
1500 if (mode != MigrationMode::kFast) {
1501 base->ExecuteMigrationObservers(dest, src, dst, size);
1502 }
1503 dst->IterateFast(dst->map(cage_base), size, base->record_visitor_);
1504 } else if (dest == TRUSTED_SPACE) {
1505 DCHECK_OBJECT_SIZE(size);
1506 DCHECK(IsAligned(size, kTaggedSize));
1507 base->heap_->CopyBlock(dst_addr, src_addr, size);
1508 if (mode != MigrationMode::kFast) {
1509 base->ExecuteMigrationObservers(dest, src, dst, size);
1510 }
1511 // In case the object's map gets relocated during GC we load the old map
1512 // here. This is fine since they store the same content.
1513 dst->IterateFast(dst->map(cage_base), size, base->record_visitor_);
1514 } else if (dest == CODE_SPACE) {
1515 DCHECK_CODEOBJECT_SIZE(size);
1516 {
1517 WritableJitAllocation writable_allocation =
1518 ThreadIsolation::RegisterInstructionStreamAllocation(dst_addr,
1519 size);
1520 base->heap_->CopyBlock(dst_addr, src_addr, size);
1521 Tagged<InstructionStream> istream = InstructionStream::cast(dst);
1522 istream->Relocate(writable_allocation, dst_addr - src_addr);
1523 }
1524 if (mode != MigrationMode::kFast) {
1525 base->ExecuteMigrationObservers(dest, src, dst, size);
1526 }
1527 // In case the object's map gets relocated during GC we load the old map
1528 // here. This is fine since they store the same content.
1529 dst->IterateFast(dst->map(cage_base), size, base->record_visitor_);
1530 } else {
1531 DCHECK_OBJECT_SIZE(size);
1532 DCHECK(dest == NEW_SPACE);
1533 base->heap_->CopyBlock(dst_addr, src_addr, size);
1534 if (mode != MigrationMode::kFast) {
1535 base->ExecuteMigrationObservers(dest, src, dst, size);
1536 }
1537 }
1538
1539 if (dest == CODE_SPACE) {
1540 WritableJitAllocation jit_allocation =
1541 WritableJitAllocation::ForInstructionStream(
1542 InstructionStream::cast(src));
1543 jit_allocation.WriteHeaderSlot<MapWord, HeapObject::kMapOffset>(
1544 MapWord::FromForwardingAddress(src, dst));
1545 } else {
1546 src->set_map_word_forwarded(dst, kRelaxedStore);
1547 }
1548 }
1549
1550 EvacuateVisitorBase(Heap* heap, EvacuationAllocator* local_allocator,
1551 MainAllocator* shared_old_allocator,
1552 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor* record_visitor)
1553 : heap_(heap),
1554 local_allocator_(local_allocator),
1555 shared_old_allocator_(shared_old_allocator),
1556 record_visitor_(record_visitor),
1557 shared_string_table_(v8_flags.shared_string_table &&
1558 heap->isolate()->has_shared_space()) {
1559 migration_function_ = RawMigrateObject<MigrationMode::kFast>;
1560#if DEBUG
1561 rng_.emplace(heap_->isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextInt64());
1562#endif // DEBUG
1563 }
1564
1565 inline bool TryEvacuateObject(AllocationSpace target_space,
1566 Tagged<HeapObject> object, int size,
1567 Tagged<HeapObject>* target_object) {
1568#if DEBUG
1569 DCHECK_LE(abort_evacuation_at_address_,
1570 MutablePageMetadata::FromHeapObject(object)->area_end());
1571 DCHECK_GE(abort_evacuation_at_address_,
1572 MutablePageMetadata::FromHeapObject(object)->area_start());
1573
1574 if (V8_UNLIKELY(object.address() >= abort_evacuation_at_address_)) {
1575 return false;
1576 }
1577#endif // DEBUG
1578
1579 Tagged<Map> map = object->map(cage_base());
1580 AllocationAlignment alignment = HeapObject::RequiredAlignment(map);
1581 AllocationResult allocation;
1582 if (target_space == OLD_SPACE && ShouldPromoteIntoSharedHeap(map)) {
1583 if (heap_->isolate()->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
1584 DCHECK_NULL(shared_old_allocator_);
1585 allocation = local_allocator_->Allocate(SHARED_SPACE, size, alignment);
1586 } else {
1587 allocation = shared_old_allocator_->AllocateRaw(size, alignment,
1588 AllocationOrigin::kGC);
1589 }
1590 } else {
1591 allocation = local_allocator_->Allocate(target_space, size, alignment);
1592 }
1593 if (allocation.To(target_object)) {
1594 MigrateObject(*target_object, object, size, target_space);
1595 return true;
1596 }
1597 return false;
1598 }
1599
1600 inline bool ShouldPromoteIntoSharedHeap(Tagged<Map> map) {
1601 if (shared_string_table_) {
1602 return String::IsInPlaceInternalizableExcludingExternal(
1603 map->instance_type());
1604 }
1605 return false;
1606 }
1607
1608 inline void ExecuteMigrationObservers(AllocationSpace dest,
1609 Tagged<HeapObject> src,
1610 Tagged<HeapObject> dst, int size) {
1611 for (MigrationObserver* obs : observers_) {
1612 obs->Move(dest, src, dst, size);
1613 }
1614 }
1615
1616 inline void MigrateObject(Tagged<HeapObject> dst, Tagged<HeapObject> src,
1617 int size, AllocationSpace dest) {
1618 migration_function_(this, dst, src, size, dest);
1619 }
1620
1621 Heap* heap_;
1622 EvacuationAllocator* local_allocator_;
1623 MainAllocator* shared_old_allocator_;
1624 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor* record_visitor_;
1625 std::vector<MigrationObserver*> observers_;
1626 MigrateFunction migration_function_;
1627 const bool shared_string_table_;
1628#if DEBUG
1629 Address abort_evacuation_at_address_{kNullAddress};
1630#endif // DEBUG
1631 base::Optional<base::RandomNumberGenerator> rng_;
1632};
1633
1634class EvacuateNewSpaceVisitor final : public EvacuateVisitorBase {
1635 public:
1636 explicit EvacuateNewSpaceVisitor(
1637 Heap* heap, EvacuationAllocator* local_allocator,
1638 MainAllocator* shared_old_allocator,
1639 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor* record_visitor,
1640 PretenuringHandler::PretenuringFeedbackMap* local_pretenuring_feedback)
1641 : EvacuateVisitorBase(heap, local_allocator, shared_old_allocator,
1642 record_visitor),
1643 promoted_size_(0),
1644 semispace_copied_size_(0),
1645 pretenuring_handler_(heap_->pretenuring_handler()),
1646 local_pretenuring_feedback_(local_pretenuring_feedback),
1647 is_incremental_marking_(heap->incremental_marking()->IsMarking()),
1648 shortcut_strings_(!heap_->IsGCWithStack() ||
1649 v8_flags.shortcut_strings_with_stack) {
1650 DCHECK_IMPLIES(is_incremental_marking_,
1651 heap->incremental_marking()->IsMajorMarking());
1652 }
1653
1654 inline bool Visit(Tagged<HeapObject> object, int size) override {
1655 if (TryEvacuateWithoutCopy(object)) return true;
1656 Tagged<HeapObject> target_object;
1657
1658 pretenuring_handler_->UpdateAllocationSite(object->map(), object,
1659 local_pretenuring_feedback_);
1660
1661 if (!TryEvacuateObject(OLD_SPACE, object, size, &target_object)) {
1662 heap_->FatalProcessOutOfMemory(
1663 "MarkCompactCollector: young object promotion failed");
1664 }
1665
1666 promoted_size_ += size;
1667 return true;
1668 }
1669
1670 intptr_t promoted_size() { return promoted_size_; }
1671 intptr_t semispace_copied_size() { return semispace_copied_size_; }
1672
1673 private:
1674 inline bool TryEvacuateWithoutCopy(Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
1675 DCHECK(!is_incremental_marking_);
1676
1677 if (!shortcut_strings_) return false;
1678
1679 Tagged<Map> map = object->map();
1680
1681 // Some objects can be evacuated without creating a copy.
1682 if (map->visitor_id() == kVisitThinString) {
1683 Tagged<HeapObject> actual = ThinString::cast(object)->unchecked_actual();
1684 if (MarkCompactCollector::IsOnEvacuationCandidate(actual)) return false;
1685 object->set_map_word_forwarded(actual, kRelaxedStore);
1686 return true;
1687 }
1688 // TODO(mlippautz): Handle ConsString.
1689
1690 return false;
1691 }
1692
1693 inline AllocationSpace AllocateTargetObject(
1694 Tagged<HeapObject> old_object, int size,
1695 Tagged<HeapObject>* target_object) {
1696 AllocationAlignment alignment =
1697 HeapObject::RequiredAlignment(old_object->map());
1698 AllocationSpace space_allocated_in = NEW_SPACE;
1699 AllocationResult allocation =
1700 local_allocator_->Allocate(NEW_SPACE, size, alignment);
1701 if (allocation.IsFailure()) {
1702 allocation = AllocateInOldSpace(size, alignment);
1703 space_allocated_in = OLD_SPACE;
1704 }
1705 bool ok = allocation.To(target_object);
1706 DCHECK(ok);
1707 USE(ok);
1708 return space_allocated_in;
1709 }
1710
1711 inline AllocationResult AllocateInOldSpace(int size_in_bytes,
1712 AllocationAlignment alignment) {
1713 AllocationResult allocation =
1714 local_allocator_->Allocate(OLD_SPACE, size_in_bytes, alignment);
1715 if (allocation.IsFailure()) {
1716 heap_->FatalProcessOutOfMemory(
1717 "MarkCompactCollector: semi-space copy, fallback in old gen");
1718 }
1719 return allocation;
1720 }
1721
1722 intptr_t promoted_size_;
1723 intptr_t semispace_copied_size_;
1724 PretenuringHandler* const pretenuring_handler_;
1725 PretenuringHandler::PretenuringFeedbackMap* local_pretenuring_feedback_;
1726 bool is_incremental_marking_;
1727 const bool shortcut_strings_;
1728};
1729
1730class EvacuateNewToOldSpacePageVisitor final : public HeapObjectVisitor {
1731 public:
1732 explicit EvacuateNewToOldSpacePageVisitor(
1733 Heap* heap, RecordMigratedSlotVisitor* record_visitor,
1734 PretenuringHandler::PretenuringFeedbackMap* local_pretenuring_feedback)
1735 : heap_(heap),
1736 record_visitor_(record_visitor),
1737 moved_bytes_(0),
1738 pretenuring_handler_(heap_->pretenuring_handler()),
1739 local_pretenuring_feedback_(local_pretenuring_feedback) {}
1740
1741 static void Move(PageMetadata* page) {
1742 page->heap()->new_space()->PromotePageToOldSpace(page);
1743 }
1744
1745 inline bool Visit(Tagged<HeapObject> object, int size) override {
1746 if (v8_flags.minor_ms) {
1747 pretenuring_handler_->UpdateAllocationSite(object->map(), object,
1748 local_pretenuring_feedback_);
1749 }
1750 DCHECK(!IsCodeSpaceObject(object));
1751 PtrComprCageBase cage_base = GetPtrComprCageBase(object);
1752 object->IterateFast(cage_base, record_visitor_);
1753 return true;
1754 }
1755
1756 intptr_t moved_bytes() { return moved_bytes_; }
1757 void account_moved_bytes(intptr_t bytes) { moved_bytes_ += bytes; }
1758
1759 private:
1760 Heap* heap_;
1761 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor* record_visitor_;
1762 intptr_t moved_bytes_;
1763 PretenuringHandler* const pretenuring_handler_;
1764 PretenuringHandler::PretenuringFeedbackMap* local_pretenuring_feedback_;
1765};
1766
1767class EvacuateOldSpaceVisitor final : public EvacuateVisitorBase {
1768 public:
1769 EvacuateOldSpaceVisitor(Heap* heap, EvacuationAllocator* local_allocator,
1770 MainAllocator* shared_old_allocator,
1771 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor* record_visitor)
1772 : EvacuateVisitorBase(heap, local_allocator, shared_old_allocator,
1773 record_visitor) {}
1774
1775 inline bool Visit(Tagged<HeapObject> object, int size) override {
1776 Tagged<HeapObject> target_object;
1777 if (TryEvacuateObject(
1778 PageMetadata::FromHeapObject(object)->owner_identity(), object,
1779 size, &target_object)) {
1780 DCHECK(object->map_word(heap_->isolate(), kRelaxedLoad)
1781 .IsForwardingAddress());
1782 return true;
1783 }
1784 return false;
1785 }
1786};
1787
1788class EvacuateRecordOnlyVisitor final : public HeapObjectVisitor {
1789 public:
1790 explicit EvacuateRecordOnlyVisitor(Heap* heap)
1791 : heap_(heap), cage_base_(heap->isolate()) {}
1792
1793 bool Visit(Tagged<HeapObject> object, int size) override {
1794 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor visitor(heap_);
1795 Tagged<Map> map = object->map(cage_base_);
1796 // Instead of calling object.IterateFast(cage_base(), &visitor) here
1797 // we can shortcut and use the precomputed size value passed to the visitor.
1798 DCHECK_EQ(object->SizeFromMap(map), size);
1799 live_object_size_ += ALIGN_TO_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT(size);
1800 object->IterateFast(map, size, &visitor);
1801 return true;
1802 }
1803
1804 size_t live_object_size() const { return live_object_size_; }
1805
1806 private:
1807 Heap* heap_;
1808 const PtrComprCageBase cage_base_;
1809 size_t live_object_size_ = 0;
1810};
1811
1812// static
1813bool MarkCompactCollector::IsUnmarkedHeapObject(Heap* heap, FullObjectSlot p) {
1814 Tagged<Object> o = *p;
1815 if (!IsHeapObject(o)) return false;
1816 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(o);
1817 if (InReadOnlySpace(heap_object)) return false;
1818 MarkCompactCollector* collector = heap->mark_compact_collector();
1819 if (V8_UNLIKELY(collector->uses_shared_heap_) &&
1820 !collector->is_shared_space_isolate_) {
1821 if (InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object)) return false;
1822 }
1823 return collector->non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(heap_object);
1824}
1825
1826// static
1827bool MarkCompactCollector::IsUnmarkedSharedHeapObject(Heap* heap,
1828 FullObjectSlot p) {
1829 Tagged<Object> o = *p;
1830 if (!IsHeapObject(o)) return false;
1831 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(o);
1832 Isolate* shared_space_isolate = heap->isolate()->shared_space_isolate();
1833 MarkCompactCollector* collector =
1834 shared_space_isolate->heap()->mark_compact_collector();
1835 if (!InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object)) return false;
1836 return collector->non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(heap_object);
1837}
1838
1839void MarkCompactCollector::MarkRoots(RootVisitor* root_visitor) {
1840 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
1841
1842 // Mark the heap roots including global variables, stack variables,
1843 // etc., and all objects reachable from them.
1844 heap_->IterateRoots(
1845 root_visitor,
1846 base::EnumSet<SkipRoot>{SkipRoot::kWeak, SkipRoot::kTracedHandles,
1847 SkipRoot::kConservativeStack,
1848 SkipRoot::kReadOnlyBuiltins});
1849
1850 // Custom marking for top optimized frame.
1851 CustomRootBodyMarkingVisitor custom_root_body_visitor(this);
1852 ProcessTopOptimizedFrame(&custom_root_body_visitor, isolate);
1853
1854 if (isolate->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
1855 ClientRootVisitor<> client_root_visitor(root_visitor);
1856 ClientObjectVisitor<> client_custom_root_body_visitor(
1857 &custom_root_body_visitor);
1858
1859 isolate->global_safepoint()->IterateClientIsolates(
1860 [this, &client_root_visitor,
1861 &client_custom_root_body_visitor](Isolate* client) {
1862 client->heap()->IterateRoots(
1863 &client_root_visitor,
1864 base::EnumSet<SkipRoot>{SkipRoot::kWeak,
1865 SkipRoot::kConservativeStack,
1866 SkipRoot::kReadOnlyBuiltins});
1867 ProcessTopOptimizedFrame(&client_custom_root_body_visitor, client);
1868 });
1869 }
1870}
1871
1872void MarkCompactCollector::MarkRootsFromConservativeStack(
1873 RootVisitor* root_visitor) {
1874 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::CONSERVATIVE_STACK_SCANNING);
1875 heap_->IterateConservativeStackRoots(root_visitor,
1876 Heap::IterateRootsMode::kMainIsolate);
1877
1878 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
1879 if (isolate->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
1880 ClientRootVisitor<> client_root_visitor(root_visitor);
1881 // For client isolates, use the stack marker to conservatively scan the
1882 // stack.
1883 isolate->global_safepoint()->IterateClientIsolates(
1884 [v = &client_root_visitor](Isolate* client) {
1885 client->heap()->IterateConservativeStackRoots(
1886 v, Heap::IterateRootsMode::kClientIsolate);
1887 });
1888 }
1889}
1890
1891void MarkCompactCollector::MarkObjectsFromClientHeaps() {
1892 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
1893 if (!isolate->is_shared_space_isolate()) return;
1894
1895 isolate->global_safepoint()->IterateClientIsolates(
1896 [collector = this](Isolate* client) {
1897 collector->MarkObjectsFromClientHeap(client);
1898 });
1899}
1900
1901void MarkCompactCollector::MarkObjectsFromClientHeap(Isolate* client) {
1902 // There is no OLD_TO_SHARED remembered set for the young generation. We
1903 // therefore need to iterate each object and check whether it points into the
1904 // shared heap. As an optimization and to avoid a second heap iteration in the
1905 // "update pointers" phase, all pointers into the shared heap are recorded in
1906 // the OLD_TO_SHARED remembered set as well.
1907 SharedHeapObjectVisitor visitor(this);
1908
1909 PtrComprCageBase cage_base(client);
1910 Heap* heap = client->heap();
1911
1912 // Finish sweeping for new space in order to iterate objects in it.
1913 heap->sweeper()->FinishMinorJobs();
1914 // Finish sweeping for old generation in order to iterate OLD_TO_SHARED.
1915 heap->sweeper()->FinishMajorJobs();
1916
1917 if (auto* new_space = heap->new_space()) {
1918 DCHECK(!heap->allocator()->new_space_allocator()->IsLabValid());
1919 for (PageMetadata* page : *new_space) {
1920 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj : HeapObjectRange(page)) {
1921 obj->IterateFast(cage_base, &visitor);
1922 }
1923 }
1924 }
1925
1926 if (heap->new_lo_space()) {
1927 std::unique_ptr<ObjectIterator> iterator =
1928 heap->new_lo_space()->GetObjectIterator(heap);
1929 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj = iterator->Next(); !obj.is_null();
1930 obj = iterator->Next()) {
1931 obj->IterateFast(cage_base, &visitor);
1932 }
1933 }
1934
1935 // In the old generation we can simply use the OLD_TO_SHARED remembered set to
1936 // find all incoming pointers into the shared heap.
1937 OldGenerationMemoryChunkIterator chunk_iterator(heap);
1938
1939 // Tracking OLD_TO_SHARED requires the write barrier.
1940 DCHECK(!v8_flags.disable_write_barriers);
1941
1942 for (MutablePageMetadata* chunk = chunk_iterator.next(); chunk;
1943 chunk = chunk_iterator.next()) {
1944 const auto slot_count = RememberedSet<OLD_TO_SHARED>::Iterate(
1945 chunk,
1946 [collector = this, cage_base](MaybeObjectSlot slot) {
1947 Tagged<MaybeObject> obj = slot.Relaxed_Load(cage_base);
1948 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
1949
1950 if (obj.GetHeapObject(&heap_object) &&
1951 InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object)) {
1952 collector->MarkRootObject(Root::kClientHeap, heap_object);
1953 return KEEP_SLOT;
1954 } else {
1955 return REMOVE_SLOT;
1956 }
1957 },
1958 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
1959 if (slot_count == 0) {
1960 chunk->ReleaseSlotSet(OLD_TO_SHARED);
1961 }
1962
1963 const auto typed_slot_count = RememberedSet<OLD_TO_SHARED>::IterateTyped(
1964 chunk, [collector = this, heap](SlotType slot_type, Address slot) {
1965 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object =
1966 UpdateTypedSlotHelper::GetTargetObject(heap, slot_type, slot);
1967 if (InWritableSharedSpace(heap_object)) {
1968 collector->MarkRootObject(Root::kClientHeap, heap_object);
1969 return KEEP_SLOT;
1970 } else {
1971 return REMOVE_SLOT;
1972 }
1973 });
1974 if (typed_slot_count == 0) {
1975 chunk->ReleaseTypedSlotSet(OLD_TO_SHARED);
1976 }
1977 }
1978
1979#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
1980 DCHECK(IsSharedExternalPointerType(kExternalStringResourceTag));
1981 DCHECK(IsSharedExternalPointerType(kExternalStringResourceDataTag));
1982 // All ExternalString resources are stored in the shared external pointer
1983 // table. Mark entries from client heaps.
1984 ExternalPointerTable& shared_table = client->shared_external_pointer_table();
1985 ExternalPointerTable::Space* shared_space =
1986 client->shared_external_pointer_space();
1987 MarkExternalPointerFromExternalStringTable external_string_visitor(
1988 &shared_table, shared_space);
1989 heap->external_string_table_.IterateAll(&external_string_visitor);
1990#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
1991}
1992
1993bool MarkCompactCollector::MarkTransitiveClosureUntilFixpoint() {
1994 int iterations = 0;
1995 int max_iterations = v8_flags.ephemeron_fixpoint_iterations;
1996
1997 bool another_ephemeron_iteration_main_thread;
1998
1999 do {
2000 PerformWrapperTracing();
2001
2002 if (iterations >= max_iterations) {
2003 // Give up fixpoint iteration and switch to linear algorithm.
2004 return false;
2005 }
2006
2007 // Move ephemerons from next_ephemerons into current_ephemerons to
2008 // drain them in this iteration.
2009 DCHECK(
2010 local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.IsLocalAndGlobalEmpty());
2011 weak_objects_.current_ephemerons.Merge(weak_objects_.next_ephemerons);
2012 heap_->concurrent_marking()->set_another_ephemeron_iteration(false);
2013
2014 {
2015 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(),
2016 GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_WEAK_CLOSURE_EPHEMERON_MARKING);
2017 another_ephemeron_iteration_main_thread = ProcessEphemerons();
2018 }
2019
2020 // Can only check for local emptiness here as parallel marking tasks may
2021 // still be running. The caller performs the CHECKs for global emptiness.
2022 CHECK(local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.IsLocalEmpty());
2023 CHECK(local_weak_objects()->discovered_ephemerons_local.IsLocalEmpty());
2024
2025 ++iterations;
2026 } while (another_ephemeron_iteration_main_thread ||
2027 heap_->concurrent_marking()->another_ephemeron_iteration() ||
2028 !local_marking_worklists_->IsEmpty() ||
2029 !IsCppHeapMarkingFinished(heap_, local_marking_worklists_.get()));
2030
2031 return true;
2032}
2033
2034bool MarkCompactCollector::ProcessEphemerons() {
2035 Ephemeron ephemeron;
2036 bool another_ephemeron_iteration = false;
2037
2038 // Drain current_ephemerons and push ephemerons where key and value are still
2039 // unreachable into next_ephemerons.
2040 while (local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.Pop(&ephemeron)) {
2041 if (ProcessEphemeron(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value)) {
2042 another_ephemeron_iteration = true;
2043 }
2044 }
2045
2046 // Drain marking worklist and push discovered ephemerons into
2047 // discovered_ephemerons.
2048 size_t objects_processed;
2049 std::tie(std::ignore, objects_processed) =
2050 ProcessMarkingWorklist(v8::base::TimeDelta::Max(), SIZE_MAX,
2051 MarkingWorklistProcessingMode::kDefault);
2052
2053 // As soon as a single object was processed and potentially marked another
2054 // object we need another iteration. Otherwise we might miss to apply
2055 // ephemeron semantics on it.
2056 if (objects_processed > 0) another_ephemeron_iteration = true;
2057
2058 // Drain discovered_ephemerons (filled in the drain MarkingWorklist-phase
2059 // before) and push ephemerons where key and value are still unreachable into
2060 // next_ephemerons.
2061 while (local_weak_objects()->discovered_ephemerons_local.Pop(&ephemeron)) {
2062 if (ProcessEphemeron(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value)) {
2063 another_ephemeron_iteration = true;
2064 }
2065 }
2066
2067 // Flush local ephemerons for main task to global pool.
2068 local_weak_objects()->ephemeron_hash_tables_local.Publish();
2069 local_weak_objects()->next_ephemerons_local.Publish();
2070
2071 return another_ephemeron_iteration;
2072}
2073
2074void MarkCompactCollector::MarkTransitiveClosureLinear() {
2075 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(),
2076 GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_WEAK_CLOSURE_EPHEMERON_LINEAR);
2077 // This phase doesn't support parallel marking.
2078 DCHECK(heap_->concurrent_marking()->IsStopped());
2079 // We must use the full pointer comparison here as this map will be queried
2080 // with objects from different cages (e.g. code- or trusted cage).
2081 std::unordered_multimap<Tagged<HeapObject>, Tagged<HeapObject>,
2082 Object::Hasher, Object::KeyEqualSafe>
2083 key_to_values;
2084 Ephemeron ephemeron;
2085
2086 DCHECK(
2087 local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.IsLocalAndGlobalEmpty());
2088 weak_objects_.current_ephemerons.Merge(weak_objects_.next_ephemerons);
2089 while (local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.Pop(&ephemeron)) {
2090 ProcessEphemeron(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value);
2091
2092 if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(ephemeron.value)) {
2093 key_to_values.insert(std::make_pair(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value));
2094 }
2095 }
2096
2097 ephemeron_marking_.newly_discovered_limit = key_to_values.size();
2098 bool work_to_do = true;
2099
2100 while (work_to_do) {
2101 PerformWrapperTracing();
2102
2103 ResetNewlyDiscovered();
2104 ephemeron_marking_.newly_discovered_limit = key_to_values.size();
2105
2106 {
2107 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(),
2108 GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_WEAK_CLOSURE_EPHEMERON_MARKING);
2109 // Drain marking worklist and push all discovered objects into
2110 // newly_discovered.
2111 ProcessMarkingWorklist(
2112 v8::base::TimeDelta::Max(), SIZE_MAX,
2113 MarkingWorklistProcessingMode::kTrackNewlyDiscoveredObjects);
2114 }
2115
2116 while (local_weak_objects()->discovered_ephemerons_local.Pop(&ephemeron)) {
2117 ProcessEphemeron(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value);
2118
2119 if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(ephemeron.value)) {
2120 key_to_values.insert(std::make_pair(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value));
2121 }
2122 }
2123
2124 if (ephemeron_marking_.newly_discovered_overflowed) {
2125 // If newly_discovered was overflowed just visit all ephemerons in
2126 // next_ephemerons.
2127 local_weak_objects()->next_ephemerons_local.Publish();
2128 weak_objects_.next_ephemerons.Iterate([&](Ephemeron ephemeron) {
2129 if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(ephemeron.key) &&
2130 non_atomic_marking_state_->TryMark(ephemeron.value)) {
2131 local_marking_worklists_->Push(ephemeron.value);
2132 }
2133 });
2134
2135 } else {
2136 // This is the good case: newly_discovered stores all discovered
2137 // objects. Now use key_to_values to see if discovered objects keep more
2138 // objects alive due to ephemeron semantics.
2139 for (Tagged<HeapObject> object : ephemeron_marking_.newly_discovered) {
2140 auto range = key_to_values.equal_range(object);
2141 for (auto it = range.first; it != range.second; ++it) {
2142 Tagged<HeapObject> value = it->second;
2143 MarkObject(object, value);
2144 }
2145 }
2146 }
2147
2148 // Do NOT drain marking worklist here, otherwise the current checks
2149 // for work_to_do are not sufficient for determining if another iteration
2150 // is necessary.
2151
2152 work_to_do =
2153 !local_marking_worklists_->IsEmpty() ||
2154 !IsCppHeapMarkingFinished(heap_, local_marking_worklists_.get());
2155 CHECK(local_weak_objects()
2156 ->discovered_ephemerons_local.IsLocalAndGlobalEmpty());
2157 }
2158
2159 ResetNewlyDiscovered();
2160 ephemeron_marking_.newly_discovered.shrink_to_fit();
2161
2162 CHECK(local_marking_worklists_->IsEmpty());
2163
2164 CHECK(weak_objects_.current_ephemerons.IsEmpty());
2165 CHECK(weak_objects_.discovered_ephemerons.IsEmpty());
2166
2167 // Flush local ephemerons for main task to global pool.
2168 local_weak_objects()->ephemeron_hash_tables_local.Publish();
2169 local_weak_objects()->next_ephemerons_local.Publish();
2170}
2171
2172void MarkCompactCollector::PerformWrapperTracing() {
2173 auto* cpp_heap = CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap_);
2174 if (!cpp_heap) return;
2175
2176 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_EMBEDDER_TRACING);
2177 cpp_heap->AdvanceTracing(v8::base::TimeDelta::Max());
2178}
2179
2180namespace {
2181
2182constexpr size_t kDeadlineCheckInterval = 128u;
2183
2184} // namespace
2185
2186std::pair<size_t, size_t> MarkCompactCollector::ProcessMarkingWorklist(
2187 v8::base::TimeDelta max_duration, size_t max_bytes_to_process,
2188 MarkingWorklistProcessingMode mode) {
2189 Tagged<HeapObject> object;
2190 size_t bytes_processed = 0;
2191 size_t objects_processed = 0;
2192 bool is_per_context_mode = local_marking_worklists_->IsPerContextMode();
2193 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
2194 const auto start = v8::base::TimeTicks::Now();
2195 PtrComprCageBase cage_base(isolate);
2196
2197 if (parallel_marking_ && UseBackgroundThreadsInCycle()) {
2198 heap_->concurrent_marking()->RescheduleJobIfNeeded(
2199 GarbageCollector::MARK_COMPACTOR, TaskPriority::kUserBlocking);
2200 }
2201
2202 while (local_marking_worklists_->Pop(&object) ||
2203 local_marking_worklists_->PopOnHold(&object)) {
2204 // The marking worklist should never contain filler objects.
2205 CHECK(!IsFreeSpaceOrFiller(object, cage_base));
2206 DCHECK(IsHeapObject(object));
2207 DCHECK(!InReadOnlySpace(object));
2208 DCHECK_EQ(GetIsolateFromWritableObject(object), isolate);
2209 DCHECK(heap_->Contains(object));
2210 DCHECK(!(marking_state_->IsUnmarked(object)));
2211 if (mode == MarkCompactCollector::MarkingWorklistProcessingMode::
2212 kTrackNewlyDiscoveredObjects) {
2213 AddNewlyDiscovered(object);
2214 }
2215 Tagged<Map> map = object->map(cage_base);
2216 if (is_per_context_mode) {
2217 Address context;
2218 if (native_context_inferrer_.Infer(cage_base, map, object, &context)) {
2219 local_marking_worklists_->SwitchToContext(context);
2220 }
2221 }
2222 const auto visited_size = marking_visitor_->Visit(map, object);
2223 if (visited_size) {
