2224 MutablePageMetadata::FromHeapObject(object)->IncrementLiveBytesAtomically(
2225 ALIGN_TO_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT(visited_size));
2226 }
2227 if (is_per_context_mode) {
2228 native_context_stats_.IncrementSize(local_marking_worklists_->Context(),
2229 map, object, visited_size);
2230 }
2231 bytes_processed += visited_size;
2232 objects_processed++;
2233 static_assert(base::bits::IsPowerOfTwo(kDeadlineCheckInterval),
2234 "kDeadlineCheckInterval must be power of 2");
2235 // The below check is an optimized version of
2236 // `(objects_processed % kDeadlineCheckInterval) == 0`
2237 if ((objects_processed & (kDeadlineCheckInterval -1)) == 0 &&
2238 ((v8::base::TimeTicks::Now() - start) > max_duration)) {
2239 break;
2240 }
2241 if (bytes_processed >= max_bytes_to_process) {
2242 break;
2243 }
2244 }
2245 return std::make_pair(bytes_processed, objects_processed);
2246}
2247
2248bool MarkCompactCollector::ProcessEphemeron(Tagged<HeapObject> key,
2249 Tagged<HeapObject> value) {
2250 // Objects in the shared heap are prohibited from being used as keys in
2251 // WeakMaps and WeakSets and therefore cannot be ephemeron keys, because that
2252 // would enable thread local -> shared heap edges.
2253 DCHECK(!InWritableSharedSpace(key));
2254 // Usually values that should not be marked are not added to the ephemeron
2255 // worklist. However, minor collection during incremental marking may promote
2256 // strings from the younger generation into the shared heap. This
2257 // ShouldMarkObject call catches those cases.
2258 if (!ShouldMarkObject(value)) return false;
2259 if (marking_state_->IsMarked(key)) {
2260 if (marking_state_->TryMark(value)) {
2261 local_marking_worklists_->Push(value);
2262 return true;
2263 }
2264
2265 } else if (marking_state_->IsUnmarked(value)) {
2266 local_weak_objects()->next_ephemerons_local.Push(Ephemeron{key, value});
2267 }
2268 return false;
2269}
2270
2271void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyEphemeronMarking() {
2272#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
2273 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) {
2274 Ephemeron ephemeron;
2275
2276 DCHECK(
2277 local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.IsLocalAndGlobalEmpty());
2278 weak_objects_.current_ephemerons.Merge(weak_objects_.next_ephemerons);
2279 while (local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.Pop(&ephemeron)) {
2280 CHECK(!ProcessEphemeron(ephemeron.key, ephemeron.value));
2281 }
2282 }
2283#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
2284}
2285
2286void MarkCompactCollector::MarkTransitiveClosure() {
2287 // Incremental marking might leave ephemerons in main task's local
2288 // buffer, flush it into global pool.
2289 local_weak_objects()->next_ephemerons_local.Publish();
2290
2291 if (!MarkTransitiveClosureUntilFixpoint()) {
2292 // Fixpoint iteration needed too many iterations and was cancelled. Use the
2293 // guaranteed linear algorithm. But only in the final single-thread marking
2294 // phase.
2295 if (!parallel_marking_) MarkTransitiveClosureLinear();
2296 }
2297}
2298
2299void MarkCompactCollector::ProcessTopOptimizedFrame(ObjectVisitor* visitor,
2300 Isolate* isolate) {
2301 for (StackFrameIterator it(isolate, isolate->thread_local_top()); !it.done();
2302 it.Advance()) {
2303 if (it.frame()->is_unoptimized()) return;
2304 if (it.frame()->is_optimized()) {
2305 Tagged<GcSafeCode> lookup_result = it.frame()->GcSafeLookupCode();
2306 if (!lookup_result->has_instruction_stream()) return;
2307 if (!lookup_result->CanDeoptAt(isolate,
2308 it.frame()->maybe_unauthenticated_pc())) {
2309 Tagged<InstructionStream> istream = InstructionStream::unchecked_cast(
2310 lookup_result->raw_instruction_stream());
2311 PtrComprCageBase cage_base(isolate);
2312 InstructionStream::BodyDescriptor::IterateBody(istream->map(cage_base),
2313 istream, visitor);
2314 }
2315 return;
2316 }
2317 }
2318}
2319
2320void MarkCompactCollector::RecordObjectStats() {
2321 if (V8_LIKELY(!TracingFlags::is_gc_stats_enabled())) return;
2322 // Cannot run during bootstrapping due to incomplete objects.
2323 if (heap_->isolate()->bootstrapper()->IsActive()) return;
2324 TRACE_EVENT0(TRACE_GC_CATEGORIES, "V8.GC_OBJECT_DUMP_STATISTICS");
2325 heap_->CreateObjectStats();
2326 ObjectStatsCollector collector(heap_, heap_->live_object_stats_.get(),
2327 heap_->dead_object_stats_.get());
2328 collector.Collect();
2329 if (V8_UNLIKELY(TracingFlags::gc_stats.load(std::memory_order_relaxed) &
2330 v8::tracing::TracingCategoryObserver::ENABLED_BY_TRACING)) {
2331 std::stringstream live, dead;
2332 heap_->live_object_stats_->Dump(live);
2333 heap_->dead_object_stats_->Dump(dead);
2334 TRACE_EVENT_INSTANT2(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.gc_stats"),
2335 "V8.GC_Objects_Stats", TRACE_EVENT_SCOPE_THREAD,
2336 "live", TRACE_STR_COPY(live.str().c_str()), "dead",
2337 TRACE_STR_COPY(dead.str().c_str()));
2338 }
2339 if (v8_flags.trace_gc_object_stats) {
2340 heap_->live_object_stats_->PrintJSON("live");
2341 heap_->dead_object_stats_->PrintJSON("dead");
2342 }
2343 heap_->live_object_stats_->CheckpointObjectStats();
2344 heap_->dead_object_stats_->ClearObjectStats();
2345}
2346
2347namespace {
2348
2349bool ShouldRetainMap(MarkingState* marking_state, Tagged<Map> map, int age) {
2350 if (age == 0) {
2351 // The map has aged. Do not retain this map.
2352 return false;
2353 }
2354 Tagged<Object> constructor = map->GetConstructor();
2355 if (!IsHeapObject(constructor) ||
2356 (!InReadOnlySpace(HeapObject::cast(constructor)) &&
2357 marking_state->IsUnmarked(HeapObject::cast(constructor)))) {
2358 // The constructor is dead, no new objects with this map can
2359 // be created. Do not retain this map.
2360 return false;
2361 }
2362 return true;
2363}
2364
2365} // namespace
2366
2367void MarkCompactCollector::RetainMaps() {
2368 // Retaining maps increases the chances of reusing map transitions at some
2369 // memory cost, hence disable it when trying to reduce memory footprint more
2370 // aggressively.
2371 const bool should_retain_maps =
2372 !heap_->ShouldReduceMemory() && v8_flags.retain_maps_for_n_gc != 0;
2373
2374 for (Tagged<WeakArrayList> retained_maps : heap_->FindAllRetainedMaps()) {
2375 DCHECK_EQ(0, retained_maps->length() % 2);
2376 for (int i = 0; i < retained_maps->length(); i += 2) {
2377 Tagged<MaybeObject> value = retained_maps->Get(i);
2378 Tagged<HeapObject> map_heap_object;
2379 if (!value.GetHeapObjectIfWeak(&map_heap_object)) {
2380 continue;
2381 }
2382 int age = retained_maps->Get(i + 1).ToSmi().value();
2383 int new_age;
2384 Tagged<Map> map = Map::cast(map_heap_object);
2385 if (should_retain_maps && marking_state_->IsUnmarked(map)) {
2386 if (ShouldRetainMap(marking_state_, map, age)) {
2387 if (marking_state_->TryMark(map)) {
2388 local_marking_worklists_->Push(map);
2389 }
2390 if (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.track_retaining_path)) {
2391 heap_->AddRetainingRoot(Root::kRetainMaps, map);
2392 }
2393 }
2394 Tagged<Object> prototype = map->prototype();
2395 if (age > 0 && IsHeapObject(prototype) &&
2396 (!InReadOnlySpace(HeapObject::cast(prototype)) &&
2397 marking_state_->IsUnmarked(HeapObject::cast(prototype)))) {
2398 // The prototype is not marked, age the map.
2399 new_age = age - 1;
2400 } else {
2401 // The prototype and the constructor are marked, this map keeps only
2402 // transition tree alive, not JSObjects. Do not age the map.
2403 new_age = age;
2404 }
2405 } else {
2406 new_age = v8_flags.retain_maps_for_n_gc;
2407 }
2408 // Compact the array and update the age.
2409 if (new_age != age) {
2410 retained_maps->Set(i + 1, Smi::FromInt(new_age));
2411 }
2412 }
2413 }
2414}
2415
2416void MarkCompactCollector::MarkLiveObjects() {
2417 TRACE_GC_ARG1(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK,
2418 "UseBackgroundThreads", UseBackgroundThreadsInCycle());
2419
2420 const bool was_marked_incrementally =
2421 !heap_->incremental_marking()->IsStopped();
2422 if (was_marked_incrementally) {
2423 auto* incremental_marking = heap_->incremental_marking();
2424 TRACE_GC_WITH_FLOW(
2425 heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_FINISH_INCREMENTAL,
2426 incremental_marking->current_trace_id(), TRACE_EVENT_FLAG_FLOW_IN);
2427 DCHECK(incremental_marking->IsMajorMarking());
2428 incremental_marking->Stop();
2429 MarkingBarrier::PublishAll(heap_);
2430 }
2431
2432#ifdef DEBUG
2433 DCHECK(state_ == PREPARE_GC);
2434 state_ = MARK_LIVE_OBJECTS;
2435#endif
2436
2437 if (heap_->cpp_heap_) {
2438 CppHeap::From(heap_->cpp_heap_)
2439 ->EnterFinalPause(heap_->embedder_stack_state_);
2440 }
2441
2442 RootMarkingVisitor root_visitor(this);
2443
2444 {
2445 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_ROOTS);
2446 MarkRoots(&root_visitor);
2447 }
2448
2449 {
2450 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_CLIENT_HEAPS);
2451 MarkObjectsFromClientHeaps();
2452 }
2453
2454 {
2455 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_RETAIN_MAPS);
2456 RetainMaps();
2457 }
2458
2459 if (v8_flags.parallel_marking && UseBackgroundThreadsInCycle()) {
2460 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_FULL_CLOSURE_PARALLEL);
2461 parallel_marking_ = true;
2462 heap_->concurrent_marking()->RescheduleJobIfNeeded(
2463 GarbageCollector::MARK_COMPACTOR, TaskPriority::kUserBlocking);
2464 MarkTransitiveClosure();
2465 {
2466 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(),
2467 GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_FULL_CLOSURE_PARALLEL_JOIN);
2468 FinishConcurrentMarking();
2469 }
2470 parallel_marking_ = false;
2471 } else {
2472 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_FULL_CLOSURE_SERIAL);
2473 MarkTransitiveClosure();
2474 }
2475
2476 {
2477 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_ROOTS);
2478 MarkRootsFromConservativeStack(&root_visitor);
2479 }
2480
2481 {
2482 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_MARK_FULL_CLOSURE);
2483 // Complete the transitive closure single-threaded to avoid races with
2484 // multiple threads when processing weak maps and embedder heaps.
2485 CHECK(heap_->concurrent_marking()->IsStopped());
2486 MarkTransitiveClosure();
2487 CHECK(local_marking_worklists_->IsEmpty());
2488 CHECK(
2489 local_weak_objects()->current_ephemerons_local.IsLocalAndGlobalEmpty());
2490 CHECK(local_weak_objects()
2491 ->discovered_ephemerons_local.IsLocalAndGlobalEmpty());
2492 CHECK(IsCppHeapMarkingFinished(heap_, local_marking_worklists_.get()));
2493 VerifyEphemeronMarking();
2494 }
2495
2496 if (was_marked_incrementally) {
2497 // Disable the marking barrier after concurrent/parallel marking has
2498 // finished as it will reset page flags that share the same bitmap as
2499 // the evacuation candidate bit.
2500 MarkingBarrier::DeactivateAll(heap_);
2501 heap_->isolate()->traced_handles()->SetIsMarking(false);
2502 }
2503
2504 epoch_++;
2505}
2506
2507namespace {
2508
2509class ParallelClearingJob final : public v8::JobTask {
2510 public:
2511 class ClearingItem {
2512 public:
2513 virtual ~ClearingItem() = default;
2514 virtual void Run(JobDelegate* delegate) = 0;
2515 };
2516
2517 explicit ParallelClearingJob(MarkCompactCollector* collector)
2518 : collector_(collector) {}
2519 ~ParallelClearingJob() override = default;
2520 ParallelClearingJob(const ParallelClearingJob&) = delete;
2521 ParallelClearingJob& operator=(const ParallelClearingJob&) = delete;
2522
2523 // v8::JobTask overrides.
2524 void Run(JobDelegate* delegate) override {
2525 std::unique_ptr<ClearingItem> item;
2526 {
2527 base::MutexGuard guard(&items_mutex_);
2528 item = std::move(items_.back());
2529 items_.pop_back();
2530 }
2531 item->Run(delegate);
2532 }
2533
2534 size_t GetMaxConcurrency(size_t worker_count) const override {
2535 base::MutexGuard guard(&items_mutex_);
2536 if (!v8_flags.parallel_weak_ref_clearing ||
2537 !collector_->UseBackgroundThreadsInCycle()) {
2538 return std::min<size_t>(items_.size(), 1);
2539 }
2540 return items_.size();
2541 }
2542
2543 void Add(std::unique_ptr<ClearingItem> item) {
2544 items_.push_back(std::move(item));
2545 }
2546
2547 private:
2548 MarkCompactCollector* collector_;
2549 mutable base::Mutex items_mutex_;
2550 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<ClearingItem>> items_;
2551};
2552
2553class ClearStringTableJobItem final : public ParallelClearingJob::ClearingItem {
2554 public:
2555 explicit ClearStringTableJobItem(Isolate* isolate)
2556 : isolate_(isolate),
2557 trace_id_(reinterpret_cast<uint64_t>(this) ^
2558 isolate->heap()->tracer()->CurrentEpoch(
2559 GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_STRING_TABLE)) {}
2560
2561 void Run(JobDelegate* delegate) final {
2562 // In case multi-cage pointer compression mode is enabled ensure that
2563 // current thread's cage base values are properly initialized.
2564 PtrComprCageAccessScope ptr_compr_cage_access_scope(isolate_);
2565
2566 if (isolate_->OwnsStringTables()) {
2567 TRACE_GC1_WITH_FLOW(isolate_->heap()->tracer(),
2568 GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_STRING_TABLE,
2569 delegate->IsJoiningThread() ? ThreadKind::kMain
2570 : ThreadKind::kBackground,
2571 trace_id_, TRACE_EVENT_FLAG_FLOW_IN);
2572 // Prune the string table removing all strings only pointed to by the
2573 // string table. Cannot use string_table() here because the string
2574 // table is marked.
2575 StringTable* string_table = isolate_->string_table();
2576 InternalizedStringTableCleaner internalized_visitor(isolate_->heap());
2577 string_table->DropOldData();
2578 string_table->IterateElements(&internalized_visitor);
2579 string_table->NotifyElementsRemoved(
2580 internalized_visitor.PointersRemoved());
2581 }
2582 }
2583
2584 uint64_t trace_id() const { return trace_id_; }
2585
2586 private:
2587 Isolate* const isolate_;
2588 const uint64_t trace_id_;
2589};
2590
2591} // namespace
2592
2593class FullStringForwardingTableCleaner final
2594 : public StringForwardingTableCleanerBase {
2595 public:
2596 explicit FullStringForwardingTableCleaner(Heap* heap)
2597 : StringForwardingTableCleanerBase(heap), heap_(heap) {
2598 USE(heap_);
2599 }
2600
2601 // Transition all strings in the forwarding table to
2602 // ThinStrings/ExternalStrings and clear the table afterwards.
2603 void TransitionStrings() {
2604 DCHECK(!heap_->IsGCWithStack() ||
2605 v8_flags.transition_strings_during_gc_with_stack);
2606 StringForwardingTable* forwarding_table =
2607 isolate_->string_forwarding_table();
2608 forwarding_table->IterateElements(
2609 [&](StringForwardingTable::Record* record) {
2610 TransitionStrings(record);
2611 });
2612 forwarding_table->Reset();
2613 }
2614
2615 // When performing GC with a stack, we conservatively assume that
2616 // the GC could have been triggered by optimized code. Optimized code
2617 // assumes that flat strings don't transition during GCs, so we are not
2618 // allowed to transition strings to ThinString/ExternalString in that
2619 // case.
2620 // Instead we mark forward objects to keep them alive and update entries
2621 // of evacuated objects later.
2622 void ProcessFullWithStack() {
2623 DCHECK(heap_->IsGCWithStack() &&
2624 !v8_flags.transition_strings_during_gc_with_stack);
2625 StringForwardingTable* forwarding_table =
2626 isolate_->string_forwarding_table();
2627 forwarding_table->IterateElements(
2628 [&](StringForwardingTable::Record* record) {
2629 MarkForwardObject(record);
2630 });
2631 }
2632
2633 private:
2634 void MarkForwardObject(StringForwardingTable::Record* record) {
2635 Tagged<Object> original = record->OriginalStringObject(isolate_);
2636 if (!IsHeapObject(original)) {
2637 DCHECK_EQ(original, StringForwardingTable::deleted_element());
2638 return;
2639 }
2640 Tagged<String> original_string = String::cast(original);
2641 if (marking_state_->IsMarked(original_string)) {
2642 Tagged<Object> forward = record->ForwardStringObjectOrHash(isolate_);
2643 if (!IsHeapObject(forward) ||
2644 InReadOnlySpace(HeapObject::cast(forward))) {
2645 return;
2646 }
2647 marking_state_->TryMarkAndAccountLiveBytes(HeapObject::cast(forward));
2648 } else {
2649 DisposeExternalResource(record);
2650 record->set_original_string(StringForwardingTable::deleted_element());
2651 }
2652 }
2653
2654 void TransitionStrings(StringForwardingTable::Record* record) {
2655 Tagged<Object> original = record->OriginalStringObject(isolate_);
2656 if (!IsHeapObject(original)) {
2657 DCHECK_EQ(original, StringForwardingTable::deleted_element());
2658 return;
2659 }
2660 if (marking_state_->IsMarked(HeapObject::cast(original))) {
2661 Tagged<String> original_string = String::cast(original);
2662 if (IsThinString(original_string)) {
2663 original_string = ThinString::cast(original_string)->actual();
2664 }
2665 TryExternalize(original_string, record);
2666 TryInternalize(original_string, record);
2667 original_string->set_raw_hash_field(record->raw_hash(isolate_));
2668 } else {
2669 DisposeExternalResource(record);
2670 }
2671 }
2672
2673 void TryExternalize(Tagged<String> original_string,
2674 StringForwardingTable::Record* record) {
2675 // If the string is already external, dispose the resource.
2676 if (IsExternalString(original_string)) {
2677 record->DisposeUnusedExternalResource(original_string);
2678 return;
2679 }
2680
2681 bool is_one_byte;
2682 v8::String::ExternalStringResourceBase* external_resource =
2683 record->external_resource(&is_one_byte);
2684 if (external_resource == nullptr) return;
2685
2686 if (is_one_byte) {
2687 original_string->MakeExternalDuringGC(
2688 isolate_,
2689 reinterpret_cast<v8::String::ExternalOneByteStringResource*>(
2690 external_resource));
2691 } else {
2692 original_string->MakeExternalDuringGC(
2693 isolate_, reinterpret_cast<v8::String::ExternalStringResource*>(
2694 external_resource));
2695 }
2696 }
2697
2698 void TryInternalize(Tagged<String> original_string,
2699 StringForwardingTable::Record* record) {
2700 if (IsInternalizedString(original_string)) return;
2701 Tagged<Object> forward = record->ForwardStringObjectOrHash(isolate_);
2702 if (!IsHeapObject(forward)) {
2703 return;
2704 }
2705 Tagged<String> forward_string = String::cast(forward);
2706
2707 // Mark the forwarded string to keep it alive.
2708 if (!InReadOnlySpace(forward_string)) {
2709 marking_state_->TryMarkAndAccountLiveBytes(forward_string);
2710 }
2711 // Transition the original string to a ThinString and override the
2712 // forwarding index with the correct hash.
2713 original_string->MakeThin(isolate_, forward_string);
2714 // Record the slot in the old-to-old remembered set. This is
2715 // required as the internalized string could be relocated during
2716 // compaction.
2717 ObjectSlot slot(&ThinString::cast(original_string)->actual_);
2718 MarkCompactCollector::RecordSlot(original_string, slot, forward_string);
2719 }
2720
2721 Heap* const heap_;
2722};
2723
2724namespace {
2725
2726class SharedStructTypeRegistryCleaner final : public RootVisitor {
2727 public:
2728 explicit SharedStructTypeRegistryCleaner(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {}
2729
2730 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
2731 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
2732 UNREACHABLE();
2733 }
2734
2735 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
2736 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
2737 OffHeapObjectSlot end) override {
2738 DCHECK_EQ(root, Root::kSharedStructTypeRegistry);
2739 // The SharedStructTypeRegistry holds the canonical SharedStructType
2740 // instance maps weakly. Visit all Map pointers in [start, end), deleting
2741 // it if unmarked.
2742 auto* marking_state = heap_->marking_state();
2743 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
2744 for (OffHeapObjectSlot p = start; p < end; p++) {
2745 Tagged<Object> o = p.load(isolate);
2746 DCHECK(!IsString(o));
2747 if (IsMap(o)) {
2748 Tagged<HeapObject> map = Map::cast(o);
2749 DCHECK(InAnySharedSpace(map));
2750 if (!InReadOnlySpace(map) && marking_state->IsUnmarked(map)) {
2751 elements_removed_++;
2752 p.store(SharedStructTypeRegistry::deleted_element());
2753 }
2754 }
2755 }
2756 }
2757
2758 int ElementsRemoved() const { return elements_removed_; }
2759
2760 private:
2761 Heap* heap_;
2762 int elements_removed_ = 0;
2763};
2764
2765class ClearSharedStructTypeRegistryJobItem final
2766 : public ParallelClearingJob::ClearingItem {
2767 public:
2768 explicit ClearSharedStructTypeRegistryJobItem(Isolate* isolate)
2769 : isolate_(isolate) {
2770 DCHECK(isolate->is_shared_space_isolate());
2771 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(isolate->shared_struct_type_registry());
2772 }
2773
2774 void Run(JobDelegate* delegate) final {
2775 // In case multi-cage pointer compression mode is enabled ensure that
2776 // current thread's cage base values are properly initialized.
2777 PtrComprCageAccessScope ptr_compr_cage_access_scope(isolate_);
2778
2779 auto* registry = isolate_->shared_struct_type_registry();
2780 SharedStructTypeRegistryCleaner cleaner(isolate_->heap());
2781 registry->IterateElements(isolate_, &cleaner);
2782 registry->NotifyElementsRemoved(cleaner.ElementsRemoved());
2783 }
2784
2785 private:
2786 Isolate* const isolate_;
2787};
2788
2789} // namespace
2790
2791void MarkCompactCollector::ClearNonLiveReferences() {
2792 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR);
2793
2794 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
2795 if (isolate->OwnsStringTables()) {
2796 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(),
2797 GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_STRING_FORWARDING_TABLE);
2798 // Clear string forwarding table. Live strings are transitioned to
2799 // ThinStrings/ExternalStrings in the cleanup process, if this is a GC
2800 // without stack.
2801 // Clearing the string forwarding table must happen before clearing the
2802 // string table, as entries in the forwarding table can keep internalized
2803 // strings alive.
2804 FullStringForwardingTableCleaner forwarding_table_cleaner(heap_);
2805 if (!heap_->IsGCWithStack() ||
2806 v8_flags.transition_strings_during_gc_with_stack) {
2807 forwarding_table_cleaner.TransitionStrings();
2808 } else {
2809 forwarding_table_cleaner.ProcessFullWithStack();
2810 }
2811 }
2812
2813 {
2814 // Clear Isolate::topmost_script_having_context slot if it's not alive.
2815 Tagged<Object> maybe_caller_context =
2816 isolate->topmost_script_having_context();
2817 if (maybe_caller_context.IsHeapObject() &&
2818 !marking_state_->IsMarked(HeapObject::cast(maybe_caller_context))) {
2819 isolate->clear_topmost_script_having_context();
2820 }
2821 }
2822
2823 auto clearing_job = std::make_unique<ParallelClearingJob>(this);
2824 auto clear_string_table_job_item =
2825 std::make_unique<ClearStringTableJobItem>(isolate);
2826 const uint64_t trace_id = clear_string_table_job_item->trace_id();
2827 clearing_job->Add(std::move(clear_string_table_job_item));
2828 TRACE_GC_NOTE_WITH_FLOW("ClearStringTableJob started", trace_id,
2829 TRACE_EVENT_FLAG_FLOW_OUT);
2830 if (isolate->is_shared_space_isolate() &&
2831 isolate->shared_struct_type_registry()) {
2832 auto clear_shared_struct_type_registry_job_item =
2833 std::make_unique<ClearSharedStructTypeRegistryJobItem>(isolate);
2834 clearing_job->Add(std::move(clear_shared_struct_type_registry_job_item));
2835 }
2836 auto clearing_job_handle = V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->CreateJob(
2837 TaskPriority::kUserBlocking, std::move(clearing_job));
2838 if (v8_flags.parallel_weak_ref_clearing && UseBackgroundThreadsInCycle()) {
2839 clearing_job_handle->NotifyConcurrencyIncrease();
2840 }
2841
2842 {
2843 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_EXTERNAL_STRING_TABLE);
2844 ExternalStringTableCleanerVisitor<ExternalStringTableCleaningMode::kAll>
2845 external_visitor(heap_);
2846 heap_->external_string_table_.IterateAll(&external_visitor);
2847 heap_->external_string_table_.CleanUpAll();
2848 }
2849
2850 {
2851 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_WEAK_GLOBAL_HANDLES);
2852 // We depend on `IterateWeakRootsForPhantomHandles()` being called before
2853 // `ProcessOldCodeCandidates()` in order to identify flushed bytecode in the
2854 // CPU profiler.
2855 isolate->global_handles()->IterateWeakRootsForPhantomHandles(
2856 &IsUnmarkedHeapObject);
2857 isolate->traced_handles()->ResetDeadNodes(&IsUnmarkedHeapObject);
2858
2859 if (isolate->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
2860 isolate->global_safepoint()->IterateClientIsolates([](Isolate* client) {
2861 client->global_handles()->IterateWeakRootsForPhantomHandles(
2862 &IsUnmarkedSharedHeapObject);
2863 // No need to reset traced handles since they are always strong.
2864 });
2865 }
2866 }
2867
2868 {
2869 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_FLUSHABLE_BYTECODE);
2870 // `ProcessFlushedBaselineCandidates()` must be called after
2871 // `ProcessOldCodeCandidates()` so that we correctly set the code object on
2872 // the JSFunction after flushing.
2873 ProcessOldCodeCandidates();
2874 ProcessFlushedBaselineCandidates();
2875 }
2876
2877 {
2878 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_FLUSHED_JS_FUNCTIONS);
2879 ClearFlushedJsFunctions();
2880 }
2881
2882 {
2883 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_WEAK_LISTS);
2884 // Process the weak references.
2885 MarkCompactWeakObjectRetainer mark_compact_object_retainer(marking_state_);
2886 heap_->ProcessAllWeakReferences(&mark_compact_object_retainer);
2887 }
2888
2889 {
2890 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_MAPS);
2891 // ClearFullMapTransitions must be called before weak references are
2892 // cleared.
2893 ClearFullMapTransitions();
2894 // Weaken recorded strong DescriptorArray objects. This phase can
2895 // potentially move everywhere after `ClearFullMapTransitions()`.
2896 WeakenStrongDescriptorArrays();
2897 }
2898 {
2899 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_WEAK_REFERENCES);
2900 ClearWeakReferences();
2901 ClearWeakCollections();
2902 ClearJSWeakRefs();
2903 }
2904
2905 PROFILE(heap_->isolate(), WeakCodeClearEvent());
2906
2907 MarkDependentCodeForDeoptimization();
2908
2909#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
2910 {
2911 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP_EXTERNAL_POINTER_TABLE);
2912 // External pointer table sweeping needs to happen before evacuating live
2913 // objects as it may perform table compaction, which requires objects to
2914 // still be at the same location as during marking.
2915 //
2916 // Note we explicitly do NOT run SweepAndCompact on
2917 // read_only_external_pointer_space since these entries are all immortal by
2918 // definition.
2919 isolate->external_pointer_table().EvacuateAndSweepAndCompact(
2920 isolate->heap()->old_external_pointer_space(),
2921 isolate->heap()->young_external_pointer_space(), isolate->counters());
2922 isolate->heap()->young_external_pointer_space()->AssertEmpty();
2923 if (isolate->owns_shareable_data()) {
2924 isolate->shared_external_pointer_table().SweepAndCompact(
2925 isolate->shared_external_pointer_space(), isolate->counters());
2926 }
2927 isolate->cpp_heap_pointer_table().SweepAndCompact(
2928 isolate->heap()->cpp_heap_pointer_space(), isolate->counters());
2929 }
2930#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
2931
2932#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
2933 {
2934 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP_TRUSTED_POINTER_TABLE);
2935 isolate->trusted_pointer_table().Sweep(heap_->trusted_pointer_space(),
2936 isolate->counters());
2937 }
2938#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
2939
2940#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
2941 {
2942 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_SWEEP_CODE_POINTER_TABLE);
2943 GetProcessWideCodePointerTable()->Sweep(heap_->code_pointer_space(),
2944 isolate->counters());
2945 }
2946#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
2947
2948 {
2949 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_JOIN_JOB);
2950 clearing_job_handle->Join();
2951 }
2952
2953 if (v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits) {
2954 // TODO(333906585): Consider adjusting the dchecks that happen on clearing
2955 // and move this phase into MarkingBarrier::DeactivateAll.
2956 heap()->DeactivateMajorGCInProgressFlag();
2957 }
2958
2959 DCHECK(weak_objects_.transition_arrays.IsEmpty());
2960 DCHECK(weak_objects_.weak_references.IsEmpty());
2961 DCHECK(weak_objects_.weak_objects_in_code.IsEmpty());
2962 DCHECK(weak_objects_.js_weak_refs.IsEmpty());
2963 DCHECK(weak_objects_.weak_cells.IsEmpty());
2964 DCHECK(weak_objects_.code_flushing_candidates.IsEmpty());
2965 DCHECK(weak_objects_.baseline_flushing_candidates.IsEmpty());
2966 DCHECK(weak_objects_.flushed_js_functions.IsEmpty());
2967}
2968
2969void MarkCompactCollector::MarkDependentCodeForDeoptimization() {
2970 HeapObjectAndCode weak_object_in_code;
2971 while (local_weak_objects()->weak_objects_in_code_local.Pop(
2972 &weak_object_in_code)) {
2973 Tagged<HeapObject> object = weak_object_in_code.first;
2974 Tagged<Code> code = weak_object_in_code.second;
2975 if (!non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(object) &&
2976 !code->embedded_objects_cleared()) {
2977 if (!code->marked_for_deoptimization()) {
2978 code->SetMarkedForDeoptimization(heap_->isolate(), "weak objects");
2979 have_code_to_deoptimize_ = true;
2980 }
2981 code->ClearEmbeddedObjects(heap_);
2982 DCHECK(code->embedded_objects_cleared());
2983 }
2984 }
2985}
2986
2987void MarkCompactCollector::ClearPotentialSimpleMapTransition(
2988 Tagged<Map> dead_target) {
2989 DCHECK(non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(dead_target));
2990 Tagged<Object> potential_parent = dead_target->constructor_or_back_pointer();
2991 if (IsMap(potential_parent)) {
2992 Tagged<Map> parent = Map::cast(potential_parent);
2993 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc_obviously;
2994 if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(parent) &&
2995 TransitionsAccessor(heap_->isolate(), parent)
2996 .HasSimpleTransitionTo(dead_target)) {
2997 ClearPotentialSimpleMapTransition(parent, dead_target);
2998 }
2999 }
3000}
3001
3002void MarkCompactCollector::ClearPotentialSimpleMapTransition(
3003 Tagged<Map> map, Tagged<Map> dead_target) {
3004 DCHECK(!map->is_prototype_map());
3005 DCHECK(!dead_target->is_prototype_map());
3006 DCHECK_EQ(map->raw_transitions(), MakeWeak(dead_target));
3007 // Take ownership of the descriptor array.
3008 int number_of_own_descriptors = map->NumberOfOwnDescriptors();
3009 Tagged<DescriptorArray> descriptors =
3010 map->instance_descriptors(heap_->isolate());
3011 if (descriptors == dead_target->instance_descriptors(heap_->isolate()) &&
3012 number_of_own_descriptors > 0) {
3013 TrimDescriptorArray(map, descriptors);
3014 DCHECK(descriptors->number_of_descriptors() == number_of_own_descriptors);
3015 }
3016}
3017
3018void MarkCompactCollector::FlushBytecodeFromSFI(
3019 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared_info) {
3020 DCHECK(shared_info->HasBytecodeArray());
3021
3022 // Retain objects required for uncompiled data.
3023 Tagged<String> inferred_name = shared_info->inferred_name();
3024 int start_position = shared_info->StartPosition();
3025 int end_position = shared_info->EndPosition();
3026
3027 shared_info->DiscardCompiledMetadata(
3028 heap_->isolate(),
3029 [](Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
3030 Tagged<HeapObject> target) { RecordSlot(object, slot, target); });
3031
3032 // Replace the bytecode with an uncompiled data object.
3033 // As the bytecode arrays itself is located in trusted space, we cannot
3034 // convert that object, but instead need to convert another object living
3035 // inside the main pointer compression cage. The wrapper object is suitable
3036 // for that purpose. The size of the bytecode wrapper must therefore match
3037 // that of an UncompiledData object (it could also be larger, but it's most
3038 // efficient if the sizes match because then we can avoid creating a filler
3039 // object for the leftover space in the wrapper object).
3040 static_assert(BytecodeWrapper::kSize ==
3041 UncompiledDataWithoutPreparseData::kSize);
3042 Tagged<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array =
3043 shared_info->GetBytecodeArray(heap_->isolate());
3044 Tagged<HeapObject> compiled_data = bytecode_array->wrapper();
3045 Address compiled_data_start = compiled_data.address();
3046 int compiled_data_size = ALIGN_TO_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT(compiled_data->Size());
3047 MutablePageMetadata* chunk =
3048 MutablePageMetadata::FromAddress(compiled_data_start);
3049
3050 // Clear any recorded slots for the compiled data as being invalid.
3051 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::RemoveRange(
3052 chunk, compiled_data_start, compiled_data_start + compiled_data_size,
3053 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3054 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW_BACKGROUND>::RemoveRange(
3055 chunk, compiled_data_start, compiled_data_start + compiled_data_size,
3056 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3057 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_SHARED>::RemoveRange(
3058 chunk, compiled_data_start, compiled_data_start + compiled_data_size,
3059 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3060 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::RemoveRange(
3061 chunk, compiled_data_start, compiled_data_start + compiled_data_size,
3062 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3063
3064 // Swap the map, using set_map_after_allocation to avoid verify heap checks
3065 // which are not necessary since we are doing this during the GC atomic pause.
3066 compiled_data->set_map_after_allocation(
3067 ReadOnlyRoots(heap_).uncompiled_data_without_preparse_data_map(),
3068 SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER);
3069
3070 // Initialize the uncompiled data.
3071 Tagged<UncompiledData> uncompiled_data = UncompiledData::cast(compiled_data);
3072 uncompiled_data->InitAfterBytecodeFlush(
3073 inferred_name, start_position, end_position,
3074 [](Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
3075 Tagged<HeapObject> target) { RecordSlot(object, slot, target); });
3076
3077 // Mark the uncompiled data as black, and ensure all fields have already been
3078 // marked.
3079 DCHECK(!ShouldMarkObject(inferred_name) ||
3080 marking_state_->IsMarked(inferred_name));
3081 marking_state_->TryMarkAndAccountLiveBytes(uncompiled_data);
3082
3083 shared_info->set_uncompiled_data(uncompiled_data);
3084 DCHECK(!shared_info->is_compiled());
3085}
3086
3087void MarkCompactCollector::ProcessOldCodeCandidates() {
3088 DCHECK(v8_flags.flush_bytecode || v8_flags.flush_baseline_code ||
3089 weak_objects_.code_flushing_candidates.IsEmpty());
3090 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> flushing_candidate;
3091 int number_of_flushed_sfis = 0;
3092 while (local_weak_objects()->code_flushing_candidates_local.Pop(
3093 &flushing_candidate)) {
3094 bool is_bytecode_live;
3095 if (v8_flags.flush_baseline_code && flushing_candidate->HasBaselineCode()) {
3096 is_bytecode_live = ProcessOldBaselineSFI(flushing_candidate);
3097 } else {
3098 is_bytecode_live = ProcessOldBytecodeSFI(flushing_candidate);
3099 }
3100
3101 if (!is_bytecode_live) number_of_flushed_sfis++;
3102
3103 // Now record the slot, which has either been updated to an uncompiled data,
3104 // Baseline code or BytecodeArray which is still alive. If the sandbox is
3105 // enabled, the slot may be empty though as BytecodeArrays are referenced
3106 // through an indirect pointer. In that case, no action is necessary here.
3107 ObjectSlot slot =
3108 flushing_candidate->RawField(SharedFunctionInfo::kFunctionDataOffset);
3109 if (IsHeapObject(*slot)) {
3110 RecordSlot(flushing_candidate, slot, HeapObject::cast(*slot));
3111 }
3112 }
3113
3114 if (v8_flags.trace_flush_code) {
3115 PrintIsolate(heap_->isolate(), "%d flushed SharedFunctionInfo(s)\n",
3116 number_of_flushed_sfis);
3117 }
3118}
3119
3120bool MarkCompactCollector::ProcessOldBytecodeSFI(
3121 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> flushing_candidate) {
3122 // During flushing a BytecodeArray is transformed into an UncompiledData
3123 // in place. Seeing an UncompiledData here implies that another
3124 // SharedFunctionInfo had a reference to the same BytecodeArray and
3125 // flushed it before processing this candidate. This can happen when using
3126 // CloneSharedFunctionInfo().
3127 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
3128 const bool bytecode_already_decompiled =
3129 flushing_candidate->HasUncompiledData();
3130 const bool is_bytecode_live =
3131 !bytecode_already_decompiled &&
3132 non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(
3133 flushing_candidate->GetBytecodeArray(isolate));
3134
3135 if (!is_bytecode_live) {
3136 FlushSFI(flushing_candidate, bytecode_already_decompiled);
3137 }
3138 return is_bytecode_live;
3139}
3140
3141bool MarkCompactCollector::ProcessOldBaselineSFI(
3142 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> flushing_candidate) {
3143 Tagged<Code> baseline_code = flushing_candidate->baseline_code(kAcquireLoad);
3144 // Safe to do a relaxed load here since the Code was acquire-loaded.
3145 Tagged<InstructionStream> baseline_istream =
3146 baseline_code->instruction_stream(baseline_code->code_cage_base(),
3147 kRelaxedLoad);
3148 Tagged<HeapObject> baseline_bytecode_or_interpreter_data =
3149 baseline_code->bytecode_or_interpreter_data();
3150
3151 // During flushing a BytecodeArray is transformed into an UncompiledData
3152 // in place. Seeing an UncompiledData here implies that another
3153 // SharedFunctionInfo had a reference to the same BytecodeArray and
3154 // flushed it before processing this candidate. This can happen when using
3155 // CloneSharedFunctionInfo().
3156 const bool bytecode_already_decompiled =
3157 IsUncompiledData(baseline_bytecode_or_interpreter_data, heap_->isolate());
3158 const bool is_bytecode_live =
3159 !bytecode_already_decompiled &&
3160 non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(
3161 flushing_candidate->GetBytecodeArray(heap_->isolate()));
3162
3163 if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(baseline_istream)) {
3164 // Currently baseline code holds bytecode array strongly and it is
3165 // always ensured that bytecode is live if baseline code is live. Hence
3166 // baseline code can safely load bytecode array without any additional
3167 // checks. In future if this changes we need to update these checks to
3168 // flush code if the bytecode is not live and also update baseline code
3169 // to bailout if there is no bytecode.
3170 DCHECK(is_bytecode_live);
3171
3172 // Regardless of whether the Code is a Code or
3173 // the InstructionStream itself, if the InstructionStream is live then
3174 // the Code has to be live and will have been marked via
3175 // the owning JSFunction.
3176 DCHECK(non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(baseline_code));
3177 } else if (is_bytecode_live || bytecode_already_decompiled) {
3178 // Reset the function_data field to the BytecodeArray, InterpreterData,
3179 // or UncompiledData found on the baseline code. We can skip this step
3180 // if the BytecodeArray is not live and not already decompiled, because
3181 // FlushBytecodeFromSFI below will set the function_data field.
3182 flushing_candidate->FlushBaselineCode();
3183 }
3184
3185 if (!is_bytecode_live) {
3186 FlushSFI(flushing_candidate, bytecode_already_decompiled);
3187 }
3188 return is_bytecode_live;
3189}
3190
3191void MarkCompactCollector::FlushSFI(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi,
3192 bool bytecode_already_decompiled) {
3193 // If baseline code flushing is disabled we should only flush bytecode
3194 // from functions that don't have baseline data.
3195 DCHECK(v8_flags.flush_baseline_code || !sfi->HasBaselineCode());
3196
3197 if (bytecode_already_decompiled) {
3198 sfi->DiscardCompiledMetadata(
3199 heap_->isolate(),
3200 [](Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
3201 Tagged<HeapObject> target) { RecordSlot(object, slot, target); });
3202 } else {
3203 // If the BytecodeArray is dead, flush it, which will replace the field
3204 // with an uncompiled data object.
3205 FlushBytecodeFromSFI(sfi);
3206 }
3207}
3208
3209void MarkCompactCollector::ClearFlushedJsFunctions() {
3210 DCHECK(v8_flags.flush_bytecode ||
3211 weak_objects_.flushed_js_functions.IsEmpty());
3212 Tagged<JSFunction> flushed_js_function;
3213 while (local_weak_objects()->flushed_js_functions_local.Pop(
3214 &flushed_js_function)) {
3215 auto gc_notify_updated_slot = [](Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
3216 Tagged<Object> target) {
3217 RecordSlot(object, slot, HeapObject::cast(target));
3218 };
3219 flushed_js_function->ResetIfCodeFlushed(heap_->isolate(),
3220 gc_notify_updated_slot);
3221 }
3222}
3223
3224void MarkCompactCollector::ProcessFlushedBaselineCandidates() {
3225 DCHECK(v8_flags.flush_baseline_code ||
3226 weak_objects_.baseline_flushing_candidates.IsEmpty());
3227 Tagged<JSFunction> flushed_js_function;
3228 while (local_weak_objects()->baseline_flushing_candidates_local.Pop(
3229 &flushed_js_function)) {
3230 auto gc_notify_updated_slot = [](Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
3231 Tagged<Object> target) {
3232 RecordSlot(object, slot, HeapObject::cast(target));
3233 };
3234 flushed_js_function->ResetIfCodeFlushed(heap_->isolate(),
3235 gc_notify_updated_slot);
3236
3237#ifndef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
3238 // Record the code slot that has been updated either to CompileLazy,
3239 // InterpreterEntryTrampoline or baseline code.
3240 // This is only necessary when the sandbox is not enabled. If it is, the
3241 // Code objects are referenced through a pointer table indirection and so
3242 // remembered slots are not necessary as the Code object will update its
3243 // entry in the pointer table when it is relocated.
3244 ObjectSlot slot = flushed_js_function->RawField(JSFunction::kCodeOffset);
3245 RecordSlot(flushed_js_function, slot, HeapObject::cast(*slot));
3246#endif
3247 }
3248}
3249
3250void MarkCompactCollector::ClearFullMapTransitions() {
3251 Tagged<TransitionArray> array;
3252 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
3253 while (local_weak_objects()->transition_arrays_local.Pop(&array)) {
3254 int num_transitions = array->number_of_entries();
3255 if (num_transitions > 0) {
3256 Tagged<Map> map;
3257 // The array might contain "undefined" elements because it's not yet
3258 // filled. Allow it.
3259 if (array->GetTargetIfExists(0, isolate, &map)) {
3260 DCHECK(!map.is_null()); // Weak pointers aren't cleared yet.
3261 Tagged<Object> constructor_or_back_pointer =
3262 map->constructor_or_back_pointer();
3263 if (IsSmi(constructor_or_back_pointer)) {
3264 DCHECK(isolate->has_active_deserializer());
3265 DCHECK_EQ(constructor_or_back_pointer,
3266 Smi::uninitialized_deserialization_value());
3267 continue;
3268 }
3269 Tagged<Map> parent = Map::cast(map->constructor_or_back_pointer());
3270 bool parent_is_alive = non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(parent);
3271 Tagged<DescriptorArray> descriptors =
3272 parent_is_alive ? parent->instance_descriptors(isolate)
3273 : Tagged<DescriptorArray>();
3274 bool descriptors_owner_died =
3275 CompactTransitionArray(parent, array, descriptors);
3276 if (descriptors_owner_died) {
3277 TrimDescriptorArray(parent, descriptors);
3278 }
3279 }
3280 }
3281 }
3282}
3283
3284// Returns false if no maps have died, or if the transition array is
3285// still being deserialized.
3286bool MarkCompactCollector::TransitionArrayNeedsCompaction(
3287 Tagged<TransitionArray> transitions, int num_transitions) {
3288 for (int i = 0; i < num_transitions; ++i) {
3289 Tagged<MaybeObject> raw_target = transitions->GetRawTarget(i);
3290 if (raw_target.IsSmi()) {
3291 // This target is still being deserialized,
3292 DCHECK(heap_->isolate()->has_active_deserializer());
3293 DCHECK_EQ(raw_target.ToSmi(), Smi::uninitialized_deserialization_value());
3294#ifdef DEBUG
3295 // Targets can only be dead iff this array is fully deserialized.
3296 for (int j = 0; j < num_transitions; ++j) {
3297 DCHECK_IMPLIES(
3298 !transitions->GetRawTarget(j).IsSmi(),
3299 !non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(transitions->GetTarget(j)));
3300 }
3301#endif
3302 return false;
3303 } else if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(
3304 TransitionsAccessor::GetTargetFromRaw(raw_target))) {
3305#ifdef DEBUG
3306 // Targets can only be dead iff this array is fully deserialized.
3307 for (int j = 0; j < num_transitions; ++j) {
3308 DCHECK(!transitions->GetRawTarget(j).IsSmi());
3309 }
3310#endif
3311 return true;
3312 }
3313 }
3314 return false;
3315}
3316
3317bool MarkCompactCollector::CompactTransitionArray(
3318 Tagged<Map> map, Tagged<TransitionArray> transitions,
3319 Tagged<DescriptorArray> descriptors) {
3320 DCHECK(!map->is_prototype_map());
3321 int num_transitions = transitions->number_of_entries();
3322 if (!TransitionArrayNeedsCompaction(transitions, num_transitions)) {
3323 return false;
3324 }
3325 bool descriptors_owner_died = false;
3326 int transition_index = 0;
3327 // Compact all live transitions to the left.
3328 for (int i = 0; i < num_transitions; ++i) {
3329 Tagged<Map> target = transitions->GetTarget(i);
3330 DCHECK_EQ(target->constructor_or_back_pointer(), map);
3331 if (non_atomic_marking_state_->IsUnmarked(target)) {
3332 if (!descriptors.is_null() &&
3333 target->instance_descriptors(heap_->isolate()) == descriptors) {
3334 DCHECK(!target->is_prototype_map());
3335 descriptors_owner_died = true;
3336 }
3337 } else {
3338 if (i != transition_index) {
3339 Tagged<Name> key = transitions->GetKey(i);
3340 transitions->SetKey(transition_index, key);
3341 HeapObjectSlot key_slot = transitions->GetKeySlot(transition_index);
3342 RecordSlot(transitions, key_slot, key);
3343 Tagged<MaybeObject> raw_target = transitions->GetRawTarget(i);
3344 transitions->SetRawTarget(transition_index, raw_target);
3345 HeapObjectSlot target_slot =
3346 transitions->GetTargetSlot(transition_index);
3347 RecordSlot(transitions, target_slot, raw_target.GetHeapObject());
3348 }
3349 transition_index++;
3350 }
3351 }
3352 // If there are no transitions to be cleared, return.
3353 if (transition_index == num_transitions) {
3354 DCHECK(!descriptors_owner_died);
3355 return false;
3356 }
3357 // Note that we never eliminate a transition array, though we might right-trim
3358 // such that number_of_transitions() == 0. If this assumption changes,
3359 // TransitionArray::Insert() will need to deal with the case that a transition
3360 // array disappeared during GC.
3361 int old_capacity_in_entries = transitions->Capacity();
3362 if (transition_index < old_capacity_in_entries) {
3363 int old_capacity = transitions->length();
3364 static_assert(TransitionArray::kEntryKeyIndex == 0);
3365 DCHECK_EQ(TransitionArray::ToKeyIndex(old_capacity_in_entries),
3366 old_capacity);
3367 int new_capacity = TransitionArray::ToKeyIndex(transition_index);
3368 heap_->RightTrimArray(transitions, new_capacity, old_capacity);
3369 transitions->SetNumberOfTransitions(transition_index);
3370 }
3371 return descriptors_owner_died;
3372}
3373
3374void MarkCompactCollector::RightTrimDescriptorArray(
3375 Tagged<DescriptorArray> array, int descriptors_to_trim) {
3376 int old_nof_all_descriptors = array->number_of_all_descriptors();
3377 int new_nof_all_descriptors = old_nof_all_descriptors - descriptors_to_trim;
3378 DCHECK_LT(0, descriptors_to_trim);
3379 DCHECK_LE(0, new_nof_all_descriptors);
3380 Address start = array->GetDescriptorSlot(new_nof_all_descriptors).address();
3381 Address end = array->GetDescriptorSlot(old_nof_all_descriptors).address();
3382 MutablePageMetadata* chunk = MutablePageMetadata::FromHeapObject(array);
3383 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::RemoveRange(chunk, start, end,
3384 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3385 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW_BACKGROUND>::RemoveRange(
3386 chunk, start, end, SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3387 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_SHARED>::RemoveRange(chunk, start, end,
3388 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3389 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::RemoveRange(chunk, start, end,
3390 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
3391 if (V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS_8GB_BOOL) {
3392 Address aligned_start = ALIGN_TO_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT(start);
3393 Address aligned_end = ALIGN_TO_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT(end);
3394 if (aligned_start < aligned_end) {
3395 heap_->CreateFillerObjectAt(
3396 aligned_start, static_cast<int>(aligned_end - aligned_start));
3397 }
3398 if (heap::ShouldZapGarbage()) {
3399 Address zap_end = std::min(aligned_start, end);
3400 MemsetTagged(ObjectSlot(start),
3401 Tagged<Object>(static_cast<Address>(kZapValue)),
3402 (zap_end - start) >> kTaggedSizeLog2);
3403 }
3404 } else {
3405 heap_->CreateFillerObjectAt(start, static_cast<int>(end - start));
3406 }
3407 array->set_number_of_all_descriptors(new_nof_all_descriptors);
3408}
3409
3410void MarkCompactCollector::RecordStrongDescriptorArraysForWeakening(
3411 GlobalHandleVector<DescriptorArray> strong_descriptor_arrays) {
3412 DCHECK(heap_->incremental_marking()->IsMajorMarking());
3413 base::MutexGuard guard(&strong_descriptor_arrays_mutex_);
3414 strong_descriptor_arrays_.push_back(std::move(strong_descriptor_arrays));
3415}
3416
3417void MarkCompactCollector::WeakenStrongDescriptorArrays() {
3418 Tagged<Map> descriptor_array_map =
3419 ReadOnlyRoots(heap_->isolate()).descriptor_array_map();
3420 for (auto vec : strong_descriptor_arrays_) {
3421 for (auto it = vec.begin(); it != vec.end(); ++it) {
3422 Tagged<DescriptorArray> raw = it.raw();
3423 DCHECK(IsStrongDescriptorArray(raw));
3424 raw->set_map_safe_transition_no_write_barrier(descriptor_array_map);
3425 DCHECK_EQ(raw->raw_gc_state(kRelaxedLoad), 0);
3426 }
3427 }
3428 strong_descriptor_arrays_.clear();
3429}
3430
3431void MarkCompactCollector::TrimDescriptorArray(
3432 Tagged<Map> map, Tagged<DescriptorArray> descriptors) {
3433 int number_of_own_descriptors = map->NumberOfOwnDescriptors();
3434 if (number_of_own_descriptors == 0) {
3435 DCHECK(descriptors == ReadOnlyRoots(heap_).empty_descriptor_array());
3436 return;
3437 }
3438 int to_trim =
3439 descriptors->number_of_all_descriptors() - number_of_own_descriptors;
3440 if (to_trim > 0) {
3441 descriptors->set_number_of_descriptors(number_of_own_descriptors);
3442 RightTrimDescriptorArray(descriptors, to_trim);
3443
3444 TrimEnumCache(map, descriptors);
3445 descriptors->Sort();
3446 }
3447 DCHECK(descriptors->number_of_descriptors() == number_of_own_descriptors);
3448 map->set_owns_descriptors(true);
3449}
3450
3451void MarkCompactCollector::TrimEnumCache(Tagged<Map> map,
3452 Tagged<DescriptorArray> descriptors) {
3453 int live_enum = map->EnumLength();
3454 if (live_enum == kInvalidEnumCacheSentinel) {
3455 live_enum = map->NumberOfEnumerableProperties();
3456 }
3457 if (live_enum == 0) return descriptors->ClearEnumCache();
3458 Tagged<EnumCache> enum_cache = descriptors->enum_cache();
3459
3460 Tagged<FixedArray> keys = enum_cache->keys();
3461 int keys_length = keys->length();
3462 if (live_enum >= keys_length) return;
3463 heap_->RightTrimArray(keys, live_enum, keys_length);
3464
3465 Tagged<FixedArray> indices = enum_cache->indices();
3466 int indices_length = indices->length();
3467 if (live_enum >= indices_length) return;
3468 heap_->RightTrimArray(indices, live_enum, indices_length);
3469}
3470
3471void MarkCompactCollector::ClearWeakCollections() {
3472 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_WEAK_COLLECTIONS);
3473 Tagged<EphemeronHashTable> table;
3474 while (local_weak_objects()->ephemeron_hash_tables_local.Pop(&table)) {
3475 for (InternalIndex i : table->IterateEntries()) {
3476 Tagged<HeapObject> key = HeapObject::cast(table->KeyAt(i));
3477#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
3478 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) {
3479 Tagged<Object> value = table->ValueAt(i);
3480 if (IsHeapObject(value)) {
3481 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::cast(value);
3482 CHECK_IMPLIES(!ShouldMarkObject(key) ||
3483 non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(key),
3484 !ShouldMarkObject(heap_object) ||
3485 non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(heap_object));
3486 }
3487 }
3488#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
3489 if (!ShouldMarkObject(key)) continue;
3490 if (!non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(key)) {
3491 table->RemoveEntry(i);
3492 }
3493 }
3494 }
3495 auto* table_map = heap_->ephemeron_remembered_set()->tables();
3496 for (auto it = table_map->begin(); it != table_map->end();) {
3497 if (!non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(it->first)) {
3498 it = table_map->erase(it);
3499 } else {
3500 ++it;
3501 }
3502 }
3503}
3504
3505void MarkCompactCollector::ClearWeakReferences() {
3506 TRACE_GC(heap_->tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_CLEAR_WEAK_REFERENCES);
3507 HeapObjectAndSlot slot;
3508 Tagged<HeapObjectReference> cleared_weak_ref = ClearedValue(heap_->isolate());
3509 while (local_weak_objects()->weak_references_local.Pop(&slot)) {
3510 Tagged<HeapObject> value;
3511 // The slot could have been overwritten, so we have to treat it
3512 // as MaybeObjectSlot.
3513 MaybeObjectSlot location(slot.second);
3514 if ((*location).GetHeapObjectIfWeak(&value)) {
3515 DCHECK(!IsCell(value));
3516 if (InReadOnlySpace(value) ||
3517 non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(value)) {
3518 // The value of the weak reference is alive.
3519 RecordSlot(slot.first, HeapObjectSlot(location), value);
3520 } else {
3521 if (IsMap(value)) {
3522 // The map is non-live.
3523 ClearPotentialSimpleMapTransition(Map::cast(value));
3524 }
3525 location.store(cleared_weak_ref);
3526 }
3527 }
3528 }
3529}
3530
3531void MarkCompactCollector::ClearJSWeakRefs() {
3532 Tagged<JSWeakRef> weak_ref;
3533 Isolate* const isolate = heap_->isolate();
3534 while (local_weak_objects()->js_weak_refs_local.Pop(&weak_ref)) {
3535 Tagged<HeapObject> target = HeapObject::cast(weak_ref->target());
3536 if (!InReadOnlySpace(target) &&
3537 !non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(target)) {
3538 weak_ref->set_target(ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).undefined_value());
3539 } else {
3540 // The value of the JSWeakRef is alive.
3541 ObjectSlot slot = weak_ref->RawField(JSWeakRef::kTargetOffset);
3542 RecordSlot(weak_ref, slot, target);
3543 }
3544 }
3545 Tagged<WeakCell> weak_cell;
3546 while (local_weak_objects()->weak_cells_local.Pop(&weak_cell)) {
3547 auto gc_notify_updated_slot = [](Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
3548 Tagged<Object> target) {
3549 if (IsHeapObject(target)) {
3550 RecordSlot(object, slot, HeapObject::cast(target));
3551 }
3552 };
3553 Tagged<HeapObject> target = HeapObject::cast(weak_cell->target());
3554 if (!InReadOnlySpace(target) &&
3555 !non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(target)) {
3556 DCHECK(Object::CanBeHeldWeakly(target));
3557 // The value of the WeakCell is dead.
3558 Tagged<JSFinalizationRegistry> finalization_registry =
3559 JSFinalizationRegistry::cast(weak_cell->finalization_registry());
3560 if (!finalization_registry->scheduled_for_cleanup()) {
3561 heap_->EnqueueDirtyJSFinalizationRegistry(finalization_registry,
3562 gc_notify_updated_slot);
3563 }
3564 // We're modifying the pointers in WeakCell and JSFinalizationRegistry
3565 // during GC; thus we need to record the slots it writes. The normal write
3566 // barrier is not enough, since it's disabled before GC.
3567 weak_cell->Nullify(isolate, gc_notify_updated_slot);
3568 DCHECK(finalization_registry->NeedsCleanup());
3569 DCHECK(finalization_registry->scheduled_for_cleanup());
3570 } else {
3571 // The value of the WeakCell is alive.
3572 ObjectSlot slot = weak_cell->RawField(WeakCell::kTargetOffset);
3573 RecordSlot(weak_cell, slot, HeapObject::cast(*slot));
3574 }
3575
3576 Tagged<HeapObject> unregister_token = weak_cell->unregister_token();
3577 if (!InReadOnlySpace(unregister_token) &&
3578 !non_atomic_marking_state_->IsMarked(unregister_token)) {
3579 DCHECK(Object::CanBeHeldWeakly(unregister_token));
3580 // The unregister token is dead. Remove any corresponding entries in the
3581 // key map. Multiple WeakCell with the same token will have all their
3582 // unregister_token field set to undefined when processing the first
3583 // WeakCell. Like above, we're modifying pointers during GC, so record the
3584 // slots.
3585 Tagged<JSFinalizationRegistry> finalization_registry =
3586 JSFinalizationRegistry::cast(weak_cell->finalization_registry());
3587 finalization_registry->RemoveUnregisterToken(
3588 unregister_token, isolate,
3589 JSFinalizationRegistry::kKeepMatchedCellsInRegistry,
3590 gc_notify_updated_slot);
3591 } else {
3592 // The unregister_token is alive.
3593 ObjectSlot slot = weak_cell->RawField(WeakCell::kUnregisterTokenOffset);
3594 RecordSlot(weak_cell, slot, HeapObject::cast(*slot));
3595 }
3596 }
3597 heap_->PostFinalizationRegistryCleanupTaskIfNeeded();
3598}
3599
3600// static
3601bool MarkCompactCollector::ShouldRecordRelocSlot(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
3602 RelocInfo* rinfo,
3603 Tagged<HeapObject> target) {
3604 MemoryChunk* source_chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(host);
3605 MemoryChunk* target_chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(target);
3606 return target_chunk->IsEvacuationCandidate() &&
3607 !source_chunk->ShouldSkipEvacuationSlotRecording();
3608}
3609
3610// static
3611MarkCompactCollector::RecordRelocSlotInfo
3612MarkCompactCollector::ProcessRelocInfo(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
3613 RelocInfo* rinfo,
3614 Tagged<HeapObject> target) {
3615 RecordRelocSlotInfo result;
3616 const RelocInfo::Mode rmode = rinfo->rmode();
3617 Address addr;
3618 SlotType slot_type;
3619
3620 if (rinfo->IsInConstantPool()) {
3621 addr = rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address();
3622
3623 if (RelocInfo::IsCodeTargetMode(rmode)) {
3624 slot_type = SlotType::kConstPoolCodeEntry;
3625 } else if (RelocInfo::IsCompressedEmbeddedObject(rmode)) {
3626 slot_type = SlotType::kConstPoolEmbeddedObjectCompressed;
3627 } else {
3628 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsFullEmbeddedObject(rmode));
3629 slot_type = SlotType::kConstPoolEmbeddedObjectFull;
3630 }
3631 } else {
3632 addr = rinfo->pc();
3633
3634 if (RelocInfo::IsCodeTargetMode(rmode)) {
3635 slot_type = SlotType::kCodeEntry;
3636 } else if (RelocInfo::IsFullEmbeddedObject(rmode)) {
3637 slot_type = SlotType::kEmbeddedObjectFull;
3638 } else {
3639 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsCompressedEmbeddedObject(rmode));
3640 slot_type = SlotType::kEmbeddedObjectCompressed;
3641 }
3642 }
3643
3644 MemoryChunk* const source_chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(host);
3645 MutablePageMetadata* const source_page_metadata =
3646 MutablePageMetadata::cast(source_chunk->Metadata());
3647 const uintptr_t offset = source_chunk->Offset(addr);
3648 DCHECK_LT(offset, static_cast<uintptr_t>(TypedSlotSet::kMaxOffset));
3649 result.page_metadata = source_page_metadata;
3650 result.slot_type = slot_type;
3651 result.offset = static_cast<uint32_t>(offset);
3652
3653 return result;
3654}
3655
3656// static
3657void MarkCompactCollector::RecordRelocSlot(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
3658 RelocInfo* rinfo,
3659 Tagged<HeapObject> target) {
3660 if (!ShouldRecordRelocSlot(host, rinfo, target)) return;
3661 RecordRelocSlotInfo info = ProcessRelocInfo(host, rinfo, target);
3662
3663 // Access to TypeSlots need to be protected, since LocalHeaps might
3664 // publish code in the background thread.
3665 base::Optional<base::MutexGuard> opt_guard;
3666 if (v8_flags.concurrent_sparkplug) {
3667 opt_guard.emplace(info.page_metadata->mutex());
3668 }
3669 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::InsertTyped(info.page_metadata, info.slot_type,
3670 info.offset);
3671}
3672
3673namespace {
3674
3675// Missing specialization MakeSlotValue<FullObjectSlot, WEAK>() will turn
3676// attempt to store a weak reference to strong-only slot to a compilation error.
3677template <typename TSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType reference_type>
3678typename TSlot::TObject MakeSlotValue(Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object);
3679
3680template <>
3681Tagged<Object> MakeSlotValue<ObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3682 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3683 return heap_object;
3684}
3685
3686template <>
3687Tagged<MaybeObject>
3688MakeSlotValue<MaybeObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3689 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3690 return heap_object;
3691}
3692
3693template <>
3694Tagged<MaybeObject>
3695MakeSlotValue<MaybeObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::WEAK>(
3696 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3697 return MakeWeak(heap_object);
3698}
3699
3700template <>
3701Tagged<Object>
3702MakeSlotValue<WriteProtectedSlot<ObjectSlot>, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3703 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3704 return heap_object;
3705}
3706
3707#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
3708template <>
3709Tagged<Object> MakeSlotValue<WriteProtectedSlot<ProtectedPointerSlot>,
3710 HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3711 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3712 return heap_object;
3713}
3714#endif
3715
3716template <>
3717Tagged<Object>
3718MakeSlotValue<OffHeapObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3719 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3720 return heap_object;
3721}
3722
3723#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
3724template <>
3725Tagged<Object> MakeSlotValue<FullObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3726 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3727 return heap_object;
3728}
3729
3730template <>
3731Tagged<MaybeObject>
3732MakeSlotValue<FullMaybeObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3733 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3734 return heap_object;
3735}
3736
3737template <>
3738Tagged<MaybeObject>
3739MakeSlotValue<FullMaybeObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::WEAK>(
3740 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3741 return MakeWeak(heap_object);
3742}
3743
3744#ifdef V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
3745template <>
3746Tagged<Object>
3747MakeSlotValue<InstructionStreamSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3748 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3749 return heap_object;
3750}
3751#endif // V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
3752
3753#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
3754template <>
3755Tagged<Object>
3756MakeSlotValue<ProtectedPointerSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(
3757 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
3758 return heap_object;
3759}
3760#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
3761
3762// The following specialization
3763// MakeSlotValue<FullMaybeObjectSlot, HeapObjectReferenceType::WEAK>()
3764// is not used.
3765#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
3766
3767template <HeapObjectReferenceType reference_type, typename TSlot>
3768static inline void UpdateSlot(PtrComprCageBase cage_base, TSlot slot,
3769 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_obj) {
3770 static_assert(
3771 std::is_same<TSlot, FullObjectSlot>::value ||
3772 std::is_same<TSlot, ObjectSlot>::value ||
3773 std::is_same<TSlot, FullMaybeObjectSlot>::value ||
3774 std::is_same<TSlot, MaybeObjectSlot>::value ||
3775 std::is_same<TSlot, OffHeapObjectSlot>::value ||
3776 std::is_same<TSlot, InstructionStreamSlot>::value ||
3777 std::is_same<TSlot, ProtectedPointerSlot>::value ||
3778 std::is_same<TSlot, WriteProtectedSlot<ObjectSlot>>::value ||
3779 std::is_same<TSlot, WriteProtectedSlot<ProtectedPointerSlot>>::value,
3780 "Only [Full|OffHeap]ObjectSlot, [Full]MaybeObjectSlot, "
3781 "InstructionStreamSlot, ProtectedPointerSlot, or WriteProtectedSlot are "
3782 "expected here");
3783 MapWord map_word = heap_obj->map_word(cage_base, kRelaxedLoad);
3784 if (!map_word.IsForwardingAddress()) return;
3785 DCHECK_IMPLIES((!v8_flags.minor_ms && !Heap::InFromPage(heap_obj)),
3786 MarkCompactCollector::IsOnEvacuationCandidate(heap_obj) ||
3787 MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(heap_obj)->IsFlagSet(
3788 MemoryChunk::COMPACTION_WAS_ABORTED));
3789 typename TSlot::TObject target = MakeSlotValue<TSlot, reference_type>(
3790 map_word.ToForwardingAddress(heap_obj));
3791 // Needs to be atomic for map space compaction: This slot could be a map
3792 // word which we update while loading the map word for updating the slot
3793 // on another page.
3794 slot.Relaxed_Store(target);
3795 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits, !Heap::InFromPage(target));
3796 DCHECK(!MarkCompactCollector::IsOnEvacuationCandidate(target));
3797}
3798
3799template <typename TSlot>
3800static inline void UpdateSlot(PtrComprCageBase cage_base, TSlot slot) {
3801 typename TSlot::TObject obj = slot.Relaxed_Load(cage_base);
3802 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_obj;
3803 if constexpr (TSlot::kCanBeWeak) {
3804 if (obj.GetHeapObjectIfWeak(&heap_obj)) {
3805 return UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::WEAK>(cage_base, slot,
3806 heap_obj);
3807 }
3808 }
3809 if (obj.GetHeapObjectIfStrong(&heap_obj)) {
3810 UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(cage_base, slot, heap_obj);
3811 }
3812}
3813
3814static inline SlotCallbackResult UpdateOldToSharedSlot(
3815 PtrComprCageBase cage_base, MaybeObjectSlot slot) {
3816 Tagged<MaybeObject> obj = slot.Relaxed_Load(cage_base);
3817 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_obj;
3818
3819 if (obj.GetHeapObject(&heap_obj)) {
3820 if (obj.IsWeak()) {
3821 UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::WEAK>(cage_base, slot, heap_obj);
3822 } else {
3823 UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(cage_base, slot, heap_obj);
3824 }
3825
3826 return InWritableSharedSpace(heap_obj) ? KEEP_SLOT : REMOVE_SLOT;
3827 } else {
3828 return REMOVE_SLOT;
3829 }
3830}
3831
3832template <typename TSlot>
3833static inline void UpdateStrongSlot(PtrComprCageBase cage_base, TSlot slot) {
3834 typename TSlot::TObject obj = slot.Relaxed_Load(cage_base);
3835#ifdef V8_ENABLE_DIRECT_LOCAL
3836 if (obj.ptr() == kTaggedNullAddress) return;
3837#endif
3838 DCHECK(!HAS_WEAK_HEAP_OBJECT_TAG(obj.ptr()));
3839 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_obj;
3840 if (obj.GetHeapObject(&heap_obj)) {
3841 UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(cage_base, slot, heap_obj);
3842 }
3843}
3844
3845static inline SlotCallbackResult UpdateStrongOldToSharedSlot(
3846 PtrComprCageBase cage_base, FullMaybeObjectSlot slot) {
3847 Tagged<MaybeObject> obj = slot.Relaxed_Load(cage_base);
3848#ifdef V8_ENABLE_DIRECT_LOCAL
3849 if (obj.ptr() == kTaggedNullAddress) return REMOVE_SLOT;
3850#endif
3851 DCHECK(!HAS_WEAK_HEAP_OBJECT_TAG(obj.ptr()));
3852 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_obj;
3853 if (obj.GetHeapObject(&heap_obj)) {
3854 UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(cage_base, slot, heap_obj);
3855 return InWritableSharedSpace(heap_obj) ? KEEP_SLOT : REMOVE_SLOT;
3856 }
3857
3858 return REMOVE_SLOT;
3859}
3860
3861static inline void UpdateStrongCodeSlot(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
3862 PtrComprCageBase cage_base,
3863 PtrComprCageBase code_cage_base,
3864 InstructionStreamSlot slot) {
3865 Tagged<Object> obj = slot.Relaxed_Load(code_cage_base);
3866 DCHECK(!HAS_WEAK_HEAP_OBJECT_TAG(obj.ptr()));
3867 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_obj;
3868 if (obj.GetHeapObject(&heap_obj)) {
3869 UpdateSlot<HeapObjectReferenceType::STRONG>(cage_base, slot, heap_obj);
3870
3871 Tagged<Code> code = Code::cast(HeapObject::FromAddress(
3872 slot.address() - Code::kInstructionStreamOffset));
3873 Tagged<InstructionStream> instruction_stream =
3874 code->instruction_stream(code_cage_base);
3875 code->UpdateInstructionStart(GetIsolateForSandbox(host),
3876 instruction_stream);
3877 }
3878}
3879
3880} // namespace
3881
3882// Visitor for updating root pointers and to-space pointers.
3883// It does not expect to encounter pointers to dead objects.
3884class PointersUpdatingVisitor final : public ObjectVisitorWithCageBases,
3885 public RootVisitor {
3886 public:
3887 explicit PointersUpdatingVisitor(Heap* heap)
3888 : ObjectVisitorWithCageBases(heap) {}
3889
3890 void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot p) override {
3891 UpdateStrongSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3892 }
3893
3894 void VisitPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot p) override {
3895 UpdateSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3896 }
3897
3898 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot start,
3899 ObjectSlot end) override {
3900 for (ObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
3901 UpdateStrongSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3902 }
3903 }
3904
3905 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
3906 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
3907 for (MaybeObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
3908 UpdateSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3909 }
3910 }
3911
3912 void VisitInstructionStreamPointer(Tagged<Code> host,
3913 InstructionStreamSlot slot) override {
3914 UpdateStrongCodeSlot(host, cage_base(), code_cage_base(), slot);
3915 }
3916
3917 void VisitRootPointer(Root root, const char* description,
3918 FullObjectSlot p) override {
3919 DCHECK(!MapWord::IsPacked(p.Relaxed_Load().ptr()));
3920 UpdateRootSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3921 }
3922
3923 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
3924 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
3925 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
3926 UpdateRootSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3927 }
3928 }
3929
3930 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
3931 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
3932 OffHeapObjectSlot end) override {
3933 for (OffHeapObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
3934 UpdateRootSlotInternal(cage_base(), p);
3935 }
3936 }
3937
3938 void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
3939 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
3940 // This visitor nevers visits code objects.
3941 UNREACHABLE();
3942 }
3943
3944 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
3945 RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
3946 // This visitor nevers visits code objects.
3947 UNREACHABLE();
3948 }
3949
3950 private:
3951 static inline void UpdateRootSlotInternal(PtrComprCageBase cage_base,
3952 FullObjectSlot slot) {
3953 UpdateStrongSlot(cage_base, slot);
3954 }
3955
3956 static inline void UpdateRootSlotInternal(PtrComprCageBase cage_base,
3957 OffHeapObjectSlot slot) {
3958 UpdateStrongSlot(cage_base, slot);
3959 }
3960
3961 static inline void UpdateStrongMaybeObjectSlotInternal(
3962 PtrComprCageBase cage_base, MaybeObjectSlot slot) {
3963 UpdateStrongSlot(cage_base, slot);
3964 }
3965
3966 static inline void UpdateStrongSlotInternal(PtrComprCageBase cage_base,
3967 ObjectSlot slot) {
3968 UpdateStrongSlot(cage_base, slot);
3969 }
3970
3971 static inline void UpdateSlotInternal(PtrComprCageBase cage_base,
3972 MaybeObjectSlot slot) {
3973 UpdateSlot(cage_base, slot);
3974 }
3975};
3976
3977static Tagged<String> UpdateReferenceInExternalStringTableEntry(
3978 Heap* heap, FullObjectSlot p) {
3979 Tagged<HeapObject> old_string = Tagged<HeapObject>::cast(*p);
3980 MapWord map_word = old_string->map_word(kRelaxedLoad);
3981
3982 if (map_word.IsForwardingAddress()) {
3983 Tagged<String> new_string =
3984 Tagged<String>::cast(map_word.ToForwardingAddress(old_string));
3985
3986 if (IsExternalString(new_string)) {
3987 MutablePageMetadata::MoveExternalBackingStoreBytes(
3988 ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString,
3989 PageMetadata::FromAddress((*p).ptr()),
3990 PageMetadata::FromHeapObject(new_string),
3991 ExternalString::cast(new_string)->ExternalPayloadSize());
3992 }
3993 return new_string;
3994 }
3995
3996 return Tagged<String>::cast(*p);
3997}
3998
3999void MarkCompactCollector::EvacuatePrologue() {
4000 // New space.
4001 NewSpace* new_space = heap_->new_space();
4002
4003 if (new_space) {
4004 // Append the list of new space pages to be processed.
4005 for (PageMetadata* p : *new_space) {
4006 if (p->live_bytes() > 0) {
4007 new_space_evacuation_pages_.push_back(p);
4008 }
4009 }
4010 if (!v8_flags.minor_ms)
4011 SemiSpaceNewSpace::From(new_space)->EvacuatePrologue();
4012 }
4013
4014 if (heap_->new_lo_space()) {
4015 heap_->new_lo_space()->Flip();
4016 heap_->new_lo_space()->ResetPendingObject();
4017 }
4018
4019 // Old space.
4020 DCHECK(old_space_evacuation_pages_.empty());
4021 old_space_evacuation_pages_ = std::move(evacuation_candidates_);
4022 evacuation_candidates_.clear();
4023 DCHECK(evacuation_candidates_.empty());
4024}
4025
4026void MarkCompactCollector::EvacuateEpilogue() {
4027 aborted_evacuation_candidates_due_to_oom_.clear();
4028 aborted_evacuation_candidates_due_to_flags_.clear();
4029
4030 // New space.
4031 if (heap_->new_space()) {
4032 DCHECK_EQ(0, heap_->new_space()->Size());
4033 }
4034
4035 // Old generation. Deallocate evacuated candidate pages.
4036 ReleaseEvacuationCandidates();
4037
4038#ifdef DEBUG
4039 VerifyRememberedSetsAfterEvacuation(heap_, GarbageCollector::MARK_COMPACTOR);
4040#endif // DEBUG
4041}
4042
4043namespace {
4044MainAllocator* CreateSharedOldAllocator(Heap* heap) {
4045 if (v8_flags.shared_string_table && heap->isolate()->has_shared_space() &&
4046 !heap->isolate()->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
4047 return new MainAllocator(heap, heap->shared_allocation_space(),
4048 MainAllocator::kInGC);
4049 }
4050
4051 return nullptr;
4052}
4053} // namespace
4054
4055class Evacuator final : public Malloced {
4056 public:
4057 enum EvacuationMode {
4058 kObjectsNewToOld,
4059 kPageNewToOld,
4060 kObjectsOldToOld,
4061 };
4062
4063 static const char* EvacuationModeName(EvacuationMode mode) {
4064 switch (mode) {
4065 case kObjectsNewToOld:
4066 return "objects-new-to-old";
4067 case kPageNewToOld:
4068 return "page-new-to-old";
4069 case kObjectsOldToOld:
4070 return "objects-old-to-old";
4071 }
4072 }
4073
4074 static inline EvacuationMode ComputeEvacuationMode(MemoryChunk* chunk) {
4075 // Note: The order of checks is important in this function.
4076 if (chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::PAGE_NEW_OLD_PROMOTION))
4077 return kPageNewToOld;
4078 if (chunk->InYoungGeneration()) return kObjectsNewToOld;
4079 return kObjectsOldToOld;
4080 }
4081
4082 explicit Evacuator(Heap* heap)
4083 : heap_(heap),
4084 local_pretenuring_feedback_(
4085 PretenuringHandler::kInitialFeedbackCapacity),
4086 local_allocator_(heap_,
4087 CompactionSpaceKind::kCompactionSpaceForMarkCompact),
4088 shared_old_allocator_(CreateSharedOldAllocator(heap_)),
4089 record_visitor_(heap_),
4090 new_space_visitor_(heap_, &local_allocator_,
4091 shared_old_allocator_.get(), &record_visitor_,
4092 &local_pretenuring_feedback_),
4093 new_to_old_page_visitor_(heap_, &record_visitor_,
4094 &local_pretenuring_feedback_),
4095
4096 old_space_visitor_(heap_, &local_allocator_,
4097 shared_old_allocator_.get(), &record_visitor_),
4098 duration_(0.0),
4099 bytes_compacted_(0) {}
4100
4101 void EvacuatePage(MutablePageMetadata* chunk);
4102
4103 void AddObserver(MigrationObserver* observer) {
4104 new_space_visitor_.AddObserver(observer);
4105 old_space_visitor_.AddObserver(observer);
4106 }
4107
4108 // Merge back locally cached info sequentially. Note that this method needs
4109 // to be called from the main thread.
4110 void Finalize();
4111
4112 private:
4113 // |saved_live_bytes| returns the live bytes of the page that was processed.
4114 bool RawEvacuatePage(MutablePageMetadata* chunk);
4115
4116 inline Heap* heap() { return heap_; }
4117
4118 void ReportCompactionProgress(double duration, intptr_t bytes_compacted) {
4119 duration_ += duration;
4120 bytes_compacted_ += bytes_compacted;
4121 }
4122
4123 Heap* heap_;
4124
4125 PretenuringHandler::PretenuringFeedbackMap local_pretenuring_feedback_;
4126
4127 // Locally cached collector data.
4128 EvacuationAllocator local_allocator_;
4129
4130 // Allocator for the shared heap.
4131 std::unique_ptr<MainAllocator> shared_old_allocator_;
4132
4133 RecordMigratedSlotVisitor record_visitor_;
4134
4135 // Visitors for the corresponding spaces.
4136 EvacuateNewSpaceVisitor new_space_visitor_;
4137 EvacuateNewToOldSpacePageVisitor new_to_old_page_visitor_;
4138 EvacuateOldSpaceVisitor old_space_visitor_;
4139
4140 // Book keeping info.
4141 double duration_;
4142 intptr_t bytes_compacted_;
4143};
4144
4145void Evacuator::EvacuatePage(MutablePageMetadata* page) {
4146 TRACE_EVENT0(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.gc"), "Evacuator::EvacuatePage");
4147 DCHECK(page->SweepingDone());
4148 intptr_t saved_live_bytes = page->live_bytes();
4149 double evacuation_time = 0.0;
4150 bool success = false;
4151 {
4152 AlwaysAllocateScope always_allocate(heap_);
4153 TimedScope timed_scope(&evacuation_time);
4154 success = RawEvacuatePage(page);
4155 }
4156 ReportCompactionProgress(evacuation_time, saved_live_bytes);
4157 if (v8_flags.trace_evacuation) {
4158 MemoryChunk* chunk = page->Chunk();
4159 PrintIsolate(heap_->isolate(),
4160 "evacuation[%p]: page=%p new_space=%d "
4161 "page_evacuation=%d executable=%d can_promote=%d "
4162 "live_bytes=%" V8PRIdPTR " time=%f success=%d\n",
4163 static_cast<void*>(this), static_cast<void*>(page),
4164 chunk->InNewSpace(),
4165 chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::PAGE_NEW_OLD_PROMOTION),
4166 chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::IS_EXECUTABLE),
4167 heap_->new_space()->IsPromotionCandidate(page),
4168 saved_live_bytes, evacuation_time, success);
4169 }
4170}
4171
4172void Evacuator::Finalize() {
4173 local_allocator_.Finalize();
4174 if (shared_old_allocator_) shared_old_allocator_->FreeLinearAllocationArea();
4175 heap_->tracer()->AddCompactionEvent(duration_, bytes_compacted_);
4176 heap_->IncrementPromotedObjectsSize(new_space_visitor_.promoted_size() +
4177 new_to_old_page_visitor_.moved_bytes());
4178 heap_->IncrementNewSpaceSurvivingObjectSize(
4179 new_space_visitor_.semispace_copied_size());
4180 heap_->IncrementYoungSurvivorsCounter(
4181 new_space_visitor_.promoted_size() +
4182 new_space_visitor_.semispace_copied_size() +
4183 new_to_old_page_visitor_.moved_bytes());
4184 heap_->pretenuring_handler()->MergeAllocationSitePretenuringFeedback(
4185 local_pretenuring_feedback_);
4186}
4187
4188class LiveObjectVisitor final : AllStatic {
4189 public:
4190 // Visits marked objects using `bool Visitor::Visit(HeapObject object, size_t
4191 // size)` as long as the return value is true.
4192 //
4193 // Returns whether all objects were successfully visited. Upon returning
4194 // false, also sets `failed_object` to the object for which the visitor
4195 // returned false.
4196 template <class Visitor>
4197 static bool VisitMarkedObjects(PageMetadata* page, Visitor* visitor,
4198 Tagged<HeapObject>* failed_object);
4199
4200 // Visits marked objects using `bool Visitor::Visit(HeapObject object, size_t
4201 // size)` as long as the return value is true. Assumes that the return value
4202 // is always true (success).
4203 template <class Visitor>
4204 static void VisitMarkedObjectsNoFail(PageMetadata* page, Visitor* visitor);
4205};
4206
4207template <class Visitor>
4208bool LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjects(PageMetadata* page, Visitor* visitor,
4209 Tagged<HeapObject>* failed_object) {
4210 TRACE_EVENT0(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.gc"),
4211 "LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjects");
4212 for (auto [object, size] : LiveObjectRange(page)) {
4213 if (!visitor->Visit(object, size)) {
4214 *failed_object = object;
4215 return false;
4216 }
4217 }
4218 return true;
4219}
4220
4221template <class Visitor>
4222void LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjectsNoFail(PageMetadata* page,
4223 Visitor* visitor) {
4224 TRACE_EVENT0(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.gc"),
4225 "LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjectsNoFail");
4226 for (auto [object, size] : LiveObjectRange(page)) {
4227 const bool success = visitor->Visit(object, size);
4228 USE(success);
4229 DCHECK(success);
4230 }
4231}
4232
4233bool Evacuator::RawEvacuatePage(MutablePageMetadata* page) {
4234 MemoryChunk* chunk = page->Chunk();
4235 const EvacuationMode evacuation_mode = ComputeEvacuationMode(chunk);
4236 TRACE_EVENT2(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.gc"),
4237 "FullEvacuator::RawEvacuatePage", "evacuation_mode",
4238 EvacuationModeName(evacuation_mode), "live_bytes",
4239 page->live_bytes());
4240 switch (evacuation_mode) {
4241 case kObjectsNewToOld:
4242#if DEBUG
4243 new_space_visitor_.DisableAbortEvacuationAtAddress(page);
4244#endif // DEBUG
4245 LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjectsNoFail(PageMetadata::cast(page),
4246 &new_space_visitor_);
4247 page->ClearLiveness();
4248 break;
4249 case kPageNewToOld:
4250 if (chunk->IsLargePage()) {
4251 auto object = LargePageMetadata::cast(page)->GetObject();
4252 bool success = new_to_old_page_visitor_.Visit(object, object->Size());
4253 USE(success);
4254 DCHECK(success);
4255 } else {
4256 LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjectsNoFail(PageMetadata::cast(page),
4257 &new_to_old_page_visitor_);
4258 }
4259 new_to_old_page_visitor_.account_moved_bytes(page->live_bytes());
4260 break;
4261 case kObjectsOldToOld: {
4262#if DEBUG
4263 old_space_visitor_.SetUpAbortEvacuationAtAddress(page);
4264#endif // DEBUG
4265 Tagged<HeapObject> failed_object;
4266 if (LiveObjectVisitor::VisitMarkedObjects(
4267 PageMetadata::cast(page), &old_space_visitor_, &failed_object)) {
4268 page->ClearLiveness();
4269 } else {
4270 // Aborted compaction page. Actual processing happens on the main
4271 // thread for simplicity reasons.
4272 heap_->mark_compact_collector()
4273 ->ReportAbortedEvacuationCandidateDueToOOM(
4274 failed_object.address(), static_cast<PageMetadata*>(page));
4275 return false;
4276 }
4277 break;
4278 }
4279 }
4280
4281 return true;
4282}
4283
4284class PageEvacuationJob : public v8::JobTask {
4285 public:
4286 PageEvacuationJob(
4287 Isolate* isolate, MarkCompactCollector* collector,
4288 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<Evacuator>>* evacuators,
4289 std::vector<std::pair<ParallelWorkItem, MutablePageMetadata*>>
4290 evacuation_items)
